Travel through the darkness where the flickering bulbs make you feel like someone is holding a torch and you’re exploring the depths of a secret, ancient burial ground. Once out of the catacombs the air is sweet, with the sea breeze blowing through the streets as you venture to Miraflores for an evening along the shore.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – The Cool Talk of the Town
dayInfo.description: Wave goodbye to the beautiful shores and to Lima as you make your way to stunning Cusco, known as the Imperial City. Cusco sits 10,750 feet above sea level, giving it an extra edge in its beauty and giving you an understanding of its crisp, clean air. Watch as the cobblestone streets wind along the city, over the hills, and through the narrow spaces where buildings almost kiss. The Spanish colonial mark is still present within the city, the architectural beauty stunning along the altitudinal hillside and built on the foundation of the Inca capital. The Church of Santo Domingo rises above street level, its terraced stairs gracefully reaching the opulent door. The brick cathedral was built on top of the old Sun Temple of Koricancha, and looks like a regular church from the entrance. The street slopes down around the outside of Santo Domingo; you step inside and can see the magnitude of the cathedral. The courtyard is tiled with arches running around the border. The dome stands high and affluent beside the entrance, and looking up at the structure from the gardens makes the greatness of the church all the more prevalent, as the tiered gardens lower beside the sloping street outside. A trip to Cusco would be incomplete without a visit to Santo Domingo and a chance to witness the grandeur of the Inca influence on the Spanish architecture within the Andean city.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – The Lost Secret Found
dayInfo.description: Climb aboard the comfortable train and glide through the stunning Sacred Valley. The lush hills stretch into mountaintops and roll along the skyline. You can see the rushing water of the Urubamba River. The glass dome of the train gives you a panoramic view of the world outside that stretches along the valley and to the foothills of the Lost City. The verdant jungle brushes against the train. You can almost hear the birds humming in the canopy. Arrive in Aguas Calientes at the base of the citadel, beneath the city of Machu Picchu. Ascend to the top of the plateau where terraces climb along the mountainside. Stone steps wind you beside the craggy mountain and open up to the Lost City of Machu Picchu which watches over the rushing river of the Urubamba Valley. The quiet air makes the picture more serene. The stone remains climb up the hillside and come to rest at the top. Wander through the history and sensational ruins of the Inca Empire. The Principal Temple stands over the majority of the city, its name deriving from its solidity and near perfect construction. The rear corner is damaged from the unsettled ground causing the temple to sag slightly. The sun almost touches the mountain peaks, the stones glisten, and the Lost City whispers its secrets before sunset.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – Secrets Revealed
dayInfo.description: Return to the sensational ruins of Machu Picchu for another chance at exploring the remnants of Inca fact and historical legend. The temples are spread along the citadel, at the top of the hill and along the edges of cliffs. But the city itself is more than individual buildings; it is the sum of its parts. It should be witnessed as the collective city that it is, as opposed to separate structures on the mountain plateau. Wander through the stone ruins with the scent of morning dew evaporating from the hills and gaze at the height of the peak of Huayna Picchu, the mountain that lingers over the Lost City like a watchful eye. With only 200 people allowed to climb Huayna Picchu per day, join the road less traveled with a journey to the top. Sign your name in the history books, literally, as you will be required to sign into the guestbook at the booth at the base of the mountain. The damp, rocky foothills and lush trees stretching over the pass replace the cologne of fresh grass. The stairs can be steep at times and the rope that helps guide the walkway can be coarse; however, the mountains are stunning, the air is crisp and the clouds linger below you as you climb. Arrive at the peak of Huayna Picchu where you can look the surrounding mountains in the eye and view the panorama of the valley beneath the Lost City. The only way you will be able to describe the vista of Machu Picchu will be “breathtaking.” The climb down the mountainside will come with a cool breeze. The wonders of the citadel opened up to you from below, sparkling with secrets. Return to Aguas Calientes and board the return train to Cusco where you can settle into the evening with the sweet, tangy froth of a Pisco Sour.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – The Deeper Understanding of a Whisper
dayInfo.description: The streets of Cusco sound different in the morning, quiet and serene. You can walk through the often busy Plaza de Armas, where the romance of couples kissing or the laughter of children playing in the fountain echoes off of the buildings. The slightly bitter scent of coca tea fills the streets, the soft footsteps of a procession of nuns stroll past the trickling fountain. Sacsayhuaman shines in the sunlight as it overlooks the city, and it is one of the last views of Cusco you will have before you depart for home. Essential Peru is hidden like a poorly kept secret within the people and history of the country. Ruins climb over mountaintops and stand along cliffs. The people burst with color and happiness, their food soothing and comfortable. The cities are filled with the life of its people and its people fill the cities with life, from seaside neighborhoods to cobblestone streets. You have ventured through valleys and on top of mountains, into catacombs and on top of history. You have seen what essentially makes Peru and as your flight climbs into the sky you know that you have experienced Peru and uncovered its real secrets.

tourName: Highlights of Peru Tour: 8-Day Peruvian Adventure
placesVisited: Lima, Cusco, Machu Picchu/Aguas Calientes, Puerto Maldonado
generalInfo: Hidden secrets of centuries past are tucked into the ornate architecture of downtown Lima. Peru is a mystic destination of beauty and allure. Just beyond the hustle and bustle of city life, families gather along the shimmering shoreline of the Pacific. Meanwhile, in central Peru, open-air markets are in full swing as charismatic vendors entice shoppers with fresh produce and delicious fruit juices. Nearby, a luxurious train car chugs along the mystical Sacred Valley en route for the famed ruins of Machu Picchu. Just when you think you have seen it all, the unmatched beauty of the lush Amazon Rainforest, which is teeming with diverse plant and animal life, awaits you. During this luxurious, 8-day trip, you will partake in a once-in-lifetime excursion through the wonder of Peru.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Airport Arrival and Sunset Dinner in Miraflores
dayInfo.description: Waves crash furiously against the sandy shores and rocky cliffsides of Lima's Miraflores coastline, seagulls circle overhead as the sun casts its shimmering rays of light onto the sparkling seawaters, and grassy overhangs line the ocean's perimeter and offer the ideal lookout point for passersby and tourists. You will arrive around midday at the Jorge Chavez International Airport in Lima. Once you have made your way through customs, you will meet your private airport transfer who will escort you to your hotel. In no time, you will be traveling down Lima's highway along buzzing boulevards and around picturesque plazas. As you roll down a window, you can listen for the vivacious guitar and keyboard tunes of street musicians and the friendly solicitations from vendors as they call out their daily specials. Soon, you will arrive at your luxurious accommodation in the heart of Miraflores, which is the most exotic neighborhood in all of Lima. Your driver will help you with your bags and escort you to your hotel, where you will be greeted by your hotel staff. Later in the evening, you will venture to the city's downtown to admire the ornate architecture of the Spanish colonialists and the elaborate, stonework designs that date back to the Inca and pre-Inca era. Then, you will veer to the coastlines to indulge in an exquisite dinner at the water's edge, which will be complete with a frothy glass of pisco sour .

dayInfo.title: Lima – Tour of City Highlights and Barranco District
dayInfo.description: The early morning clamor will stream out of local cafes and in breezy public parks as city dwellers awake to a warm sunrise. Shop owners will set up outdoor booths for the day, and cafe workers will advertise daily specials on chalkboards. With each passing hour, the pace of city life quickens as taxis, cyclists, cars, and pedestrians all convene on Lima's central boulevards. On your first full day in Lima, you will partake in a customized tour of the city's major highlights. In the morning, you will meet your expert guide in front of your hotel. To begin, your guide will lead you to Lima's iconic district to witness the fascinating contrast between prehistoric, indigenous designs and the postcolonial aesthetic of the Spanish conquistadors. Ornate, wrought-iron balconies flank vibrant facades, and cobblestone streets weave past quaint cafes, monumental churches, and enchanting open-air plazas. Under the shady palm streets of Plaza de Armas, your guide will give you a brief history of pre- and post-colonial influences of the city. Then, you will step inside the Basilica and Convent of San Francisco to witness traditional Spanish designs and to explore the subterranean catacombs. In the afternoon, you will venture to the vibrant Barranco District where electric hues of blue, yellow, and orange pop against a muted backdrop. You will cross the famed Puente de los Suspiros for a panoramic view of the impressive facades before street art bursts around every corner. Here, colonial mansions have been transformed into eclectic restaurants and cafes. You can choose from one of these sites as you indulge in a lovely dinner outdoors or opt for a cafe along the moonlit bridge. In the evening, you will return to Lima to rest as you will continue your exploration toward the Andes mountains tomorrow.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Shopping in Traditional Markets and Tour of the Qorikancha Sun Temple
dayInfo.description: Taxi cabs round the bend of Plaza de Armas, locals cool off around a central fountain, and native Quechua women sell vibrant handicrafts beside the Cusco Cathedral. Travelers with large backpacks set out for their trek along the Inca Trail to the famed ruins of Machu Picchu. Today, you will arrive at the Alejandro Velasco Astete International Airport in Cusco and be met by your private guide who will transfer you to your luxury hotel in the esteemed neighborhood of San Blas. Here, white stucco buildings line narrow streets, and charming miradors provide idyllic views of the city. Your hotel staff will welcome to what has been deemed, since ancient Inca times, the navel of the world and the birthplace of the Inca Empire. You can enjoy a refreshing cup of mate de coca tea, which is a regional delicacy said to offset the effects of altitude. In the afternoon, you and your family can venture into the city for an exciting day of both guided and self-exploration. First, you will discover the open-air markets that are nestled into Cusco's hillsides and pop with vibrant hues of nearly every shade of produce. Vendors will smile wide as they cajole you into to trying local fruits like the maracuya or chirimoya . Then, in the evening, you will amble down the buzzing street of Avenida del Sol, where daily activities will be in full swing. Your expert guide will meet you in front of Qorikancha, which is Cusco's exquisite Inca Sun Temple that is adorned in gold leaf and outfitted with a flourishing garden and terrace area. At night, you can choose from a plethora of traditional dining options in the Plaza de Armas or nearby, which is where adventurous eaters can sample the Andean region's delicacy of cuy , which is guinea pig.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – Scenic Train Ride to UNESCO Ruins of Machu Picchu
dayInfo.description: Train cars chug along the winding train tracks that line the Urubamba River. Here, in the mystical Sacred Valley, Andean condors swoop overhead with their massive wingspan, and swift rivers churn quickly. Today, you and your family will indulge in a breathtaking train ride through the Sacred Valley en route to Machu Picchu's UNESCO World Heritage site. Onboard your luxurious train, you will enjoy delightful views of the luscious landscapes and will travel for approximately three and a half hours before arriving in the base city of Aguas Calientes, which was named "hot waters" for its renowned hot springs. Here, you will meet your ground transportation who will escort you to your luxury hotel. As you settle in, you will appreciate the vast scenery at the foothills of the looming Andes mountains from your private balcony that overlooks the river below. By late morning, your expert guide will meet you in front of your hotel for an invigorating first day at the ruins. Together, you will travel via private ground transportation up steep switchback roads until reaching the summit. You do not need to worry about this being physically taxing as it takes only about 30 minutes to reach. As you look out on the ruins and low-hanging clouds, you will truly feel as if you are standing on top of the world. In the moments to come, your guide will lead you to some of the most revered features of the ancient Inca citadel, including the Royal Tombs, Intimachay, and the House of the Nobles. Your guide will also point you to some of the best photo ops that can found at the site. You may even get a surprise guest in your photos as vicunas , which are native to the lands and is a close cousin of the alpaca and llama, roam the ruins.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – Exploration of the Machu Picchu Ruins and Natural Hot Springs
dayInfo.description: Indigenous birds will serenade you with their early morning songs, and the clamor of this sleepy village will begin to stir as locals and travelers gather at open-air cafes. You will enjoy an all-inclusive, locally-sourced breakfast at your hotel before exploring the city's downtown. Then, by mid-morning, you will again meet your private guide in front of your hotel for your second day of exploring the ruins. For those interested, your second day will include an adventurous hike to the top of Huayna Picchu, which is the famous mountain peak that is often photographed as the background of Machu Picchu. While the hour-long hike is steep and somewhat strenuous, at the summit, your family will indulge in awe-inspiring views of the ruins below and a seemingly endless array of undulating peaks of the Andes mountains. Afterward, you will follow your guide through the verdant pastures of Machu Picchu for additional insight into the site's key features, including the Old City Gates, the Temple of Three Windows, and Sacred Rock. Later, in the evening, you will return to Aguas Calientes, where you can experience firsthand the town's revered namesake. Luscious trails will lead you from the city's downtown to the hidden thermal baths that are nestled into the foliage and shady treetops. Over the next few hours, you can bask in these steamy waters that are said to contain medicinal healing powers. You will breathe in the fresh, mountain air as your body relaxes from an enduring day at the ruins. As the sky turns to dusk and the stars shimmer bright, you will return to your hotel to freshen up before enjoying a lovely, moonlit dinner around the town's central plaza.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Maldonado – Thrilling Tour of Peru's Amazonian Jungle
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will leave the wonders of Machu Picchu behind as you trade the illustrious mountain peaks of the Andes for the captivating greenery and unparalleled diversity of the Amazonian Jungle. As the sun begins to rise, you will depart the city of Aguas Calientes once again on the luxurious train ride along the Urubamba River. In Cusco, you will board a short, regional flight to Puerto Maldonado, which is a gorgeous port city and entryway into the depths of the Peruvian Amazon. As you step off the plane in Puerto Maldonado, churning river waters and the high-pitched coos of exotic birds will welcome you to one of the most remote corners of the world. Aromas of sweet-smelling foliage will waft in your direction. At the airport, you will be met by your ground transportation and expert guide. From there, you will then board a riverboat and glide along the swift current to your jungle oasis accommodation, which will be situated at the center of the rainforest's dense foliage. You will spend the early afternoon settling into your private luxury lodge that will be outfitted with a charming, second-story balcony and net hammocks that are perfect for relaxation. Later this afternoon, you will meet your expert guide in the front of your hotel for unparalleled exploration and adrenaline-pumping fun in the Amazon. First, you will embark on a moderate-level hike through the jungle's rich foliage as your guide points out endemic plant and animal species. You will learn about animals' habits in addition to plants that are used locally for medicinal purposes. Then, you will soar to new heights as you partake in a thrilling zipline ride through the jungle's stunning canopy layer. You will whiz past native bird species and indulge in beautiful views of the winding river before boarding your private riverboat for a nighttime exploration as the jungle's nocturnal wildlife begins to stir.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Maldonado – Culture Class and Visit to National Conservation Center
dayInfo.description: As the sun begins to rise, you can lounge on your private balcony’s hammock with a book and cup of hot tea. You can look out toward the water's edge as the Madre de Dios river teems with its lively inhabitants. By mid-morning, your expert guide will meet you at your accommodation, and today you will be provided with a more in-depth perspective on the rainforest's inhabitants and the people who are working vehemently to protect them. First, you and your guide will once again board your riverboat as you set out for the Tambopata Research Center. Here, you will meet researchers, scientists, students, and volunteers who work to protect indigenous plant and animal life and educate the public about how best to preserve the Amazon Rainforest. You will see several animals up close, including toucans, anacondas, and choro monkeys who all call the center home during their rehabilitation. Researchers will also lead you on a short hike around the nature preserve where you will learn about the surrounding flora. After a short rest at your lodge in the afternoon, you meet your guide at the water's edge. After a brief ride down the river, you will learn about the Amazon's other revered inhabitants: native tribal groups who have called the jungle home for hundreds, if not thousands, of years. Even among Peruvians, this group of people remains largely unknown and isolated. While these groups do not routinely participate in the area's tourism, you will get a flavor of local culture when you try juane de pollo , which is a native delicacy that consists of rice and chicken that is wrapped in massive banana leaves.

dayInfo.title: Lima – International Departure
dayInfo.description: The following day, you can enjoy one final morning on your private balcony before indulging in a light breakfast with your family. You will surely want to snap a few photos to capture your remarkable experience, and you can listen one last time for the coos and chirps of energetic birdlife. Soon, your guide will greet you at your lodge accommodation to guide you into your private riverboat for a final cruise down the Madre de Dios River. As you cruise down the river, you can look out at the swinging treetops and the sparkling waters. Shortly, your riverboat will dock on the shoreline, and you will meet your private ground transport and transfer to the Puerto Maldonado airport for your departing flight.

tourName: History of Peru Tour: Ancient Ruins, Colonial Remnants, Colorful Culture
placesVisited: Lima, Cusco, Arequipa
generalInfo: The looming peaks of the Andes Mountains and crevices of the Sacred Valley conceal some of Peru's best-kept secrets. You will uncover it all and much more as you tour this magnificent treasure trove of historical and cultural gems. Behold the Grand Inca innovations in ancient citadels along the massive stone alleyway of downtown Cusco. Later, marvel at exquisite examples of Spanish architecture in Arequipa at the central plaza. However, all pale in comparison to the extraordinary beauty of the Inca's greatest masterpiece: the UNESCO World Heritage site of Machu Picchu.

dayInfo.title: Lima - International Arrival and Stroll through Coastal Parks
dayInfo.description: Citrusy lemon-lime aromas of Peru's revered ceviche wafts in your direction as you step off the plane at Lima's International Airport. A refreshing ocean breeze will surround you as you make your way to baggage claim, enticing you to uncover the beautiful beaches just outside. After passing through customs, you will meet your expert guide and be whisked away to the center of the city via your private transfer. As you arrive at your five-star colonial hotel in the heart of the historic district, friendly hotel staff will offer you a cup of mate de coca tea, a traditional tea that will later help you adjust to new altitudes as you move east. Then, after a few moments of relaxation, you and your group will venture into the city for an exhilarating first day of exploration. Surely, you will fall in love with the charming cobbled streets of the old city, set in place by the Spanish conquistadors hundreds of years ago. You will also marvel at the massive stone walls the Incas constructed with impeccable construction. After pausing for some shade in the Plaza de Armas, you will return to the oceanfront for a romantic dinner.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Visit to Local Markets and Private Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: It's off on a jet plane to the mystical beauty of the Andes Mountains and outstretched Sacred Valley. Together, the mountains and valleys cradle what was once deemed "the navel of the world," or Cusco, as most people know it today. Early morning, you will board a regional flight from Lima to Cusco. A few hours later when you land, you will meet your local expert guide who will lead you to your beautiful hotel in the white stucco neighborhood of San Blas. Again, you will be greeted with mate de coca tea and can enjoy some rest as you adjust to the significant jump in altitude. That afternoon, once you've rested up, you will explore the vibrant open-aired markets of Cusco's downtown and beyond. You can barter for handicrafts and jewelry, pottery, and woolen goods. You will visit produce markets that offer some of the most delectable freshly squeezed fruit juices the region has to offer. In the evening, you will join a world-renowned chef for a step-by-step cooking class where you will learn to make one of the region's most beloved dishes: escabeche . You can mix this appetizing blend of freshly grilled chicken and tangy pickled vegetables to enjoy momentarily with a glass of red wine.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Saqsayhuaman, Tambomachay, Qorikancha
dayInfo.description: While much of the city's historical gems lay inside the walls of Cusco, some reach just beyond. Today, you will traverse a variety of terrains to get an up-close look at the Inca Empire's most impressive pursuits. After a light breakfast near your hotel, you will join your expert guide at the Plaza de Armas. In an exhilarating combi ride, you will speed along the Avenida del Sol, a frenzy of daily activity for locals on their way to work or pausing to chat with local vendors. The grand Qorikancha, or Sun Temple, bursts from amongst the regular city fervor in great juxtaposition. From in front of the temple, a beautiful array of carefully coiffed gardens emerge. As you enter, you will marvel at the opulent gold leaf interior. That afternoon, you will venture beyond the confines of the city limits to explore two additional Incan masterpieces. First, at Tambomachay, you will behold beautiful irrigation systems that once served as the noble baths for royalty escaping the hustle and bustle of city life in Cusco. Then, in Saqsayhuaman, you will admire the fortitude of the massive stone walls of the steadfast fortress, a refuge for locals escaping outside intrusions, especially during the Spanish invasion.

dayInfo.title: Sacred Valley - Zipline and Horseback Riding in Chinchero
dayInfo.description: Beauty radiates from sunkissed fields the following day as you begin your journey through the Sacred Valley. This majestic landscape is best known as the guiding path that leads the Incas from Cusco to their coveted masterpiece at Machu Picchu. Today, many travelers still make the trek along what's known as the Inca Trail to get a sense of this impressive feat firsthand. Your day begins at full-throttle as the anticipation for the ruins of Machu Picchu also builds. Today, you will have the chance to mount a thrilling zipline from peak to valley as Andean condors soar by and waters of the Urubamba River churn fervently below. Your journey through the Sacred Valley continues, this time, on horseback. Rolling hills sparkle under the sun's warm rays and bright, white stucco buildings, for which the city is best known, emerge. Here, in the picturesque village town of Chinchero, you will partake in a delicious meal, also considered a Peruvian delicacy: cuy , or guinea pig. For travelers with specific preferences or dietary restraints, alternatives will also be made available.

dayInfo.title: Machu Picchu - UNESCO World Heritage Site
dayInfo.description: Today will perhaps be the pinnacle of your trip as you visit the famed ruins of Machu Picchu, to which millions of visitors from around the world flock each year. As you will soon realize, not only are the ruins themselves stunning, but the majestic peaks behind them are truly just as remarkable. You will begin the day with a luxury train ride from Ollantaytambo to a town called Aguas Calientes, located at the base of Machu Picchu. Beautiful panoramic windows allow you to marvel at the agricultural terracing, quaint farmlands, and vibrant bridges that burst with color over the Urubamba River. Momentarily, you will arrive and drop off your bags at your luxury lodge accommodations nestled into the hillside. Then, you can join your expert guide for a thrilling ride up the switchbacks of the Andes en route to the ruins themselves. As you step foot on the UNESCO grounds, you will surely be in awe of the spectacular mountain tops that genuinely seem to cascade into infinity. You will spend the day exploring the most fascinating features of the ruins, including the Sacred Rock, the Principal Plaza, and the Temple of Three Windows. You will even have a chance to summit Huyana Picchu, the famed mountain peak located at Machu Picchu's rear.

dayInfo.title: Arequipa - Architectural Tour and El Misti Volcano
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will venture south as you uncover the beauty of a city called Arequipa. Here, you will admire the unique blend of culture, tradition, and natural beauty found at the stunning El Misti Volcano. You will begin your day will a tour of the city's historic center alongside your expert guide. You will visit such revered sites as the Santa Catalina Monastery and the Cathedral Monastery located just off the main square. You won't want to miss a peek inside the Santuarios Andinos Museum, which includes examples of Inca mummification more than 500 years old. After the quick dig into local history, it's time to focus on culture. A brief visit to San Camilo Market offers wafts of fresh spices and produces including regional favorites, chirimoya and maracuya . Finally, it's all about natural beauty when you embark on a short ride to the stoic El Misti Volcano, perched above the city at an impressive 5,822 meters. Its beautiful snow-capped peaks contrast with the illustrious greenery down below. It's an ideal photo opportunity that encompasses the city's modern opulence and natural beauty.

dayInfo.title: Lima - Shopping District and International Departure
dayInfo.description: Finally, on your last day in Peru, you will return to the quickened pace of city life in Lima. Here, you will have the chance to explore the city one more time on your own. You can partake in souvenir shopping downtown, or stroll through the city's many art and history museums with lovely examples of Inca and pre-Inca pottery. You can also soak in the sunshine a little while longer as you walk through the Parque del Amor or around the Plaza San Martin. As time allows, you can even hitch a bike ride south to the beautifully rich neighborhood of the Barranco District. Here, buildings burst with color, and street art pops out from nearly every angle. You will listen to melodic street buskers as you walk across the Puente de los Suspiros bridge for the best view of the city. You can enjoy a light lunch here before returning to your hotel. At the hotel, you will again meet your guide and board your private transport en route to Lima's Airport. From there, you will connect to your international flights home, surely, with plans to return soon.

tourName: Idyllic Peruvian Getaway Tour for All Ages
placesVisited: Lima, Isla Palomino, Cusco, Machu Picchu, Aguas Calientes
generalInfo: The vast treasures of Lima, Peru will be yours to uncover during this 7-day journey that will have you indulging in many of the most exclusive experiences that this country has to offer. Discover the mystic ruins of ancient civilizations and the wonders of modern life in the eclectic city of Lima. Explore the ruins of Machu Picchu, Cruise along the water of Isla Palomino during a marine wildlife exploration, and visit Inca ruins.

dayInfo.title: Lima - International Arrival
dayInfo.description: Over the course of your week in this illustrious country, you will discover that Peru is a treasure trove of historical gems. Upon landing, you will meet your private ground transportation and journey to Lima's center, where you will settle in to your hotel. You will spend the afternoon and evening hours traversing Lima's downtown at your leisure. You can amble along the shoreline in the city's opulent neighborhood of Miraflores. After visiting the beautiful Parque del Amor at sunset, you can choose from a variety of dining options, each with stunning views that overlook the Pacific.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Pisco Sour Tasting
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will join your expert guide in Lima's Plaza de Armas after breakfast for a comprehensive tour of the city's highlights. The first stop of your tour will bring you to the illuminated Plaza de Armas. During your tour, you will have the opportunity to step inside the Basilica and Convent of San Francisco of Lima to witness its elaborate interior and famed catacombs. You will then venture to the Torre Tagle Palace, which is an extraordinary example of Spanish architecture with its bright exterior and careful stonework. Later in the day, you will partake in an exquisite pisco sour tasting event along the illustrious coastline.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Discover Huaca Pucllana
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will have a quick breakfast at your hotel before transferring to the ruins of Huaca Pucllana. This adobe and clay pyramid is reminiscent of the ancient culture, which pre-dates even the Incas and their most famous citadels, including Machu Picchu. After touring the pyramid, you will visit the central plaza and stone walls along the outer edge. In the evening, you will return to Lima for a luxurious dinner along the shoreline and will have the option to choose between a variety of high-end restaurants in Miraflores.

dayInfo.title: Isla Palomino - Scenic Cruise and Marine Life
dayInfo.description: Today, you will embark on a day-long cruise to the alluring island of Isla Palomino. Here, you will witness the island’s incredible scenery in addition to being provided with the unique opportunity to witness some of the region's most spectacular sea life. As the sun begins to wane in the sky, you will return to the mainland, where you can rest your feet and enjoy the panoramic views from a luxurious cafe. You can relax with a small sampling of tapas or ceviche before indulging in other local favorites, such as escabeche de pescado , which is a sauteed medley of fish, peppers, onion, and cumin.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Downtown Exploration
dayInfo.description: Today, you will soon find yourself on the edge of the Sacred Valley, ascending to the captivating city of Cusco, which is the jumping-off point to the famed ruins of Machu Picchu, which you will see tomorrow. Once your plane lands, you will be escorted to your accommodation. In the afternoon, you will venture into the city to explore its wonder. During your tour, you will pass the open-aired markets, where women sell handicrafts, fruits, and vegetables of every variety. Afterward, you will make your way along the frenzied Avenida del Sol for a chance to step inside the opulent Inca temple of Qorikancha. Later in the evening, you will venture to the illustrious neighborhood of San Blas.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes - Tour of the Machu Picchu Ruins
dayInfo.description: As the sun warms the hillside that surrounds Cusco City, you will journey to the ruins of Machu Picchu. After a light breakfast at your hotel, you will meet your expert guide, and together, you will board Peru's most luxurious train and ride through the Sacred Valley. Within just a few hours, you will arrive in the base city of Aguas Calientes. After settling in to your luxurious accommodation, you will meet your guide for a customized tour of the ruins. You will visit prominent features of the Machu Picchu’s citadel, including the Temple of Three Windows, the Principal Plaza, and the Sacred Rock. In the evening, you will return to the city of Aguas Calientes.

dayInfo.title: Lima - Departure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will breathe in the fresh mountain air and listen to the swift stream of the Urubamba River from your hotel balcony. During the morning hours, you can venture into the city center and enjoy a light breakfast before shopping for souvenirs. By mid-morning, you will board the scenic train for a ride back to Cusco. Soon, you will arrive in Poroy, and from there, you will be transferred to Cusco's regional airport. You will fly to Lima before boarding your international flight home.

tourName: Immersive Rainforest and Inca Trail Peru Tour
placesVisited: Cusco, Sacred Valley, Machu Picchu
generalInfo: With deserts, jungles, mountains, and coastlines, Peru presents a paradise of ecological diversity throughout this 10-day tour of the Amazon and Andes. This carefully curated vacation has been designed to provide an up-close and personal glimpse at this stunning nation. This adventure also gives you access to many unique opportunities for an unforgettable trip in addition to housing you in some of the most comfortable accommodations in the country.

dayInfo.title: Lima – The Land of the Inca
dayInfo.description: Tucked on the western coast of South America, Peru provides an exotic world through which visitors can explore the country's culture and natural beauty. From the lofty heights of the Andes and the depths of the Sacred Valley to the steaming jungle of the Amazon, Peru will present you with unparalleled ecological diversity. Upon your arrival to the country's capital city, a transfer will meet and drive you to your nearby hotel in the heart of Lima.

dayInfo.title: Tambopata Research Center – An Amazonian Introduction
dayInfo.description: As the main gateway into the country, Lima and its surroundings present an excellent opportunity to begin your immersion into the Peruvian landscape and culture. After you enjoy breakfast at your hotel, you will make your way by domestic flight into the heart of the Amazonian wilderness. Your final destination will be the scenic and colorful Tambopata Natural Reserve. After a comfortable drive and boat ride, you will celebrate your arrival at the scenic research center with a guided night walk to witness the area's abundant biodiversity.

dayInfo.title: Tambopata Research Center – The Peruvian Rainforest
dayInfo.description: Perhaps, it will be the distinctive call of the blue-throated piping-guan or the smell of freshly brewed coffee from the staff that welcomes you to the Amazon. Your first morning in the Amazon will be a blend of the thrilling isolation of your accommodation and the modern comforts you are able to enjoy. The Tambopata Research Center will present you with a menu of activities and access points that will allow you to bask in the ambiance of this jungle paradise. Whether you take to the trails in search of scenic overlooks or participate in a bird-watching excursion, there will be much to see and do.

dayInfo.title: Tambopata Research Center – Peru's Biodiversity
dayInfo.description: The flora and fauna of the Amazon will welcome you when you wake. Surrounded by the lush vegetation and the green canopy overhead, you will get in touch with your inner Hiram Bingham by enjoying a bird-watching excursion at dawn or by hitting the snooze button until your delicious breakfast. Options for you include a trip to a nearby waterfowl-viewing platform, a rainforest hike, and a night walk to witness the Amazon's nocturnal animals in their element.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – An Inca Orientation at 11,000 Feet
dayInfo.description: Today, you will turn your back on the Amazonian paradise you have been enjoying and cross into a whole new environment. After breakfast, you will make your way back to Puerto Maldonado by boat, which will be followed by a comfortable drive. From there, a short flight will fly you to your gateway to the Andes mountains and the civilization that once flourished at these high elevations. Upon your arrival to your accommodation, you will be met by your guide for a thorough introduction to the city.

dayInfo.title: The Sacred Valley – Secrets of the Urubamba
dayInfo.description: In 1983, Cusco was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and it will take you little time to see why when you begin your exploration of the region's many architectural and historical treasures. After breakfast, you will depart the city and make your way to the Inca fortress of Sacsayhuaman to enjoy fabulous views before venturing to the village of Pisac and the textile center at Ahuanacancha. During this journey, you will be accompanied by a local guide, who will be knowledgable in the history and significance of each monument you visit.

dayInfo.title: Sacred Valley – Hidden Gems of the Incas
dayInfo.description: Peru's inhabitants have been taking advantage of its environmental diversity for centuries. Today, you will enjoy a front-row seat to this heritage when visiting a functioning series of Andean salt flats that date back to the time of the Inca. After departing your hotel, you will visit the mysterious ruins at Moray with its terraced hillside and sweeping views before making your way to the spring-fed salt flats that have been providing locals with this precious commodity for generations. You can then enjoy an optional mountain-biking excursion as well.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – Peru's Early Inhabitants
dayInfo.description: Comfortable walking shoes will be the vehicle of choice when you embark on a journey that will have you walking in the footsteps of the Inca on the trail they once used, which connects the hilltop town of Machu Picchu to the Sacred Valley. With steep drop-offs, this thrilling trekking journey will lead you past Winay Wayna, the Sun Gate, and other famous Inca sites before descending to the famous ruins. It will all be downhill from there. After you are introduced to Machu Picchu, you will continue your descent to the intact village of Aguas Calientes and your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – The Hilltop Ruins
dayInfo.description: Your final full day on this Peruvian tour will on a guided tour of the ruins of Machu Picchu to hear the tale of its early inhabitants, civilizational development, and eventual encounter with Europeans. The same slopes you descended yesterday will be climbed, but this time, a bus will be doing the climbing for you. Upon your arrival, fresh legs will carry you along the terraced hillsides, crumbling stone halls, and to Huayna Picchu for the best views of the site. In the afternoon, you will board the train back to Cusco.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Departure
dayInfo.description: At 11,000 feet, there is little atmosphere to interrupt the vibrant morning light that will flitter across the city of Cusco. After enjoying a leisurely morning, you will have a little time to explore the Spanish and Inca influences of this town before making your way to the airport for your connecting flight to Lima.

tourName: Immersive Vacation to Lima: Peru’s Capital City
placesVisited: Lima, Pachacamac District, Paracas, Huacachina, Ica, Islas Ballestas
generalInfo: Frenzied city life in Peru's national capital of Lima rises to a pinnacle with each passing hour. Traffic zooms around quaint, post-colonial plazas while children play energetic games of soccer in grassy pastures. Aromas of lemon-lime ceviche linger in the air while couples stroll along picturesque coastlines that overlook the Pacific. The Pacific’s Ocean waters teem with fascinating marine life while indigenous birds swoop overhead. Meanwhile, less than an hour from the effervescent metropolis, ancient ruins stoically erect in the distance and allude to a rich history of the Inca and pre-Inca era. On this luxurious, 7-day tour, you will experience true comfort as you are transferred privately to each destination while staying in the most immaculate accommodations that Peru has to offer.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Touchdown and Sunset Dinner at Water's Edge
dayInfo.description: In Lima, cars whiz down hectic central avenues while cyclists weave in and out of traffic. Taxis will round massive central plazas to pick up excited groups of shoppers. Nearby, children will squeal with excitement during a game of tag or soccer in a grassy green park, and flowers will burst with colors. Meanwhile, couples will meander down a scenic pedestrian strip that snakes along the dazzling coastline. Upon landing at the Jorge Chávez International Airport, you will meet your private airport transfer. From here, you will board your ground transportation and travel to your luxurious hotel accommodation at the center of the nation's bustling capital. As your car bumps along cobbled streets, you will have the opportunity to admire the ornate, post-colonial architecture that was constructed between the 16th and 19th century. Nearby, street vendors will shout the best deals on colorful textiles, intricately crafted pottery, and handmade jewelry. In no time, you will arrive at the front door of your esteemed hotel, and you will be able to take a moment to unpack and settle in. You will be provided with your first bird's eye glimpse of the city from your beautiful hotel balcony. Then, in the evening, you will venture to the opulent neighborhood of Miraflores, where locals and visitors alike delight in a sunset meal as waves crash in the distance. Families will gather nearby to look out on the water as paragliders disappear from a rocky cliffside into the horizon. A plethora of high-end dining options await you, each overlooking the iridescent coastline. A moonlight stroll at water's edge will prove the perfect way to culminate your first night as you sip on the lime undertones of Peru's frothy pisco sour .

dayInfo.title: Lima – Tour of City Highlights and Private Ceviche Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will wake with a creamy cup of coffee or a Peruvian tea that is known as mate de coca. Then, you will meet your knowledgeable guide in front of your hotel for a customized tour of the city's highlights. Together, you will amble down picturesque stone streets that are flanked by intricate balconies and shady palm trees. You will soon come to the bright yellow facade of the Church and Convent of San Francisco. Once inside, you will marvel at the lavish wood carvings and meticulous hand-painted artwork as you learn about the influence of the Spanish conquistadors in Peru. The church's basement level offers a fascinating look at the catacombs where more than 30,000 people were buried in the early 1800s. As you return to street level, you will notice gorgeous post-colonial balconies as they hang over the downtown city streets. Your guide will lead you to excellent examples of this exquisite architecture, which will only be two of the nearly 1,600 Spanish-style balconies that are scattered throughout the city. Finally, you will come to the prestigious Plaza de Armas where vibrant facades pop against the muted stone streets, and shady palm trees offer relief from the heat as you learn more about Peru's recent past and politics since its founding as a Republic in 1821. In the afternoon, your taste buds will water during an authentic ceviche cooking class that will be led by a world-renowned chef. You will learn about the origins of this delectable meal and Peru's most famous dish before rolling up your sleeves to put your newly developed culinary skills to the test. You will begin by marinating fresh shrimp with the tantalizing flavors of zesty lemon and lime. Your instructor will then lead you in chopping tomatoes, onions, jalapenos, and cilantro to add a satisfying crunch into the mix. You can finish your dish off with a sprinkle of salt and pepper before relaxing on a gorgeous, moonlit patio to indulge in your masterpiece.

dayInfo.title: Huacachina/Ica – Sand Dune Buggy Ride and Rural Wine Tasting
dayInfo.description: Steamy temperatures of the hot desert climate will subside as thrill-seekers whiz across the undulating sand dunes of Huacachina. On your third day in Peru, you will break away from the hectic bustle of downtown Lima and prepare for the thrill of a lifetime atop the dunes in the Ica province. Once a resort town for Lima's elite, the Huacachina desert oasis of today is surrounded by high-end hotels and swanky restaurants. When you arrive in the base town, your private guide will welcome you and give you a brief history of the city. Then, you and your adventure guide will hop into your all-terrain dune buggy for the day. Your dune buggy will traverse the massive sand dunes while wind whistles through your hair with a refreshing breeze present. In the distance, you will spot the shimmering oasis lagoon as it sparkles with the sun's rays. When you have had all the thrill you can take, you can pause for some photos opportunities at the summit of several dunes. Around midday, you can catch your breath as you recover from the hair raising adrenaline rush as you descend on the charming lagoon oasis. Here, you can relax and indulge in a bite to eat at one of the dozens of restaurants in the vicinity. You can also refresh with a freshly squeezed mango or maracuya juice, which are both endemic fruits of Peru. In the afternoon, you will be enchanted by the rolling, green hills of Ica's countryside as you make your way to a lovely vineyard. As you arrive, lights will illuminate an idyllic, outdoor tasting room that is complete with a lush vineyard in the background. Verdant pastures will disappear along the illuminated horizon, and here, you can sample the illustrious, sweet, and dry wines from the region that are famous. Late this evening, you will be escorted to your luxury accommodation in Ica's countryside before an exciting boat cruise tomorrow morning.

dayInfo.title: Paracas/Islas Ballestas – Scenic Boat Cruise and Beach Relaxation
dayInfo.description: Peru’s ocean waters will glisten as the sun rises in the sky, and gulls may swoop down without warning as they search for something to eat. Beachgoers will set out brightly colored towels and blankets for a peaceful day of rest while cobalt sea waters teem with vivacious marine life. Today, you will relocate your adventures to the sea when you board a luxurious boat cruise to the Islas Ballestas . Peru is well-regarded for its incredibly diverse plant and animal life, and you will soon see why. As you navigate the rolling waves of the sparkling Pacific Ocean, you will soon come to a rocky alcove where dozens of native sea lions, which are also known as the "Sea Wolf" or "South American Sea Lion," have taken refuge. On the rocky cliffside, you will be sure to spot the easily recognizable and waddling feet of the Humboldt penguin. Then, you can check out the myriad of seabirds that may be circling overhead, including gulls, pelicans, and terns. You may even spot the native Guanay . Not all sea animals are visible at first glance, though. You may need to scan the deep blue waters for such unique creatures as the Humpback whale, which makes the migration north to warmer temperatures. Although you will have a chance to see the whales, there is no guarantee that they will be spotted. The marine otter also often hides itself away here, so consider yourself lucky if you happen to catch a peek of either of these creatures. In the afternoon, the sandy shores of Paracas will be the perfect spot to relax as you look out on the shimmering coastline. You can dig your toes into the sandy shoreline before choosing from several authentic dining options, each with idyllic coastal views. Later, you will indulge in one of many coveted Peruvian dishes like escabeche de pescado or arroz con mariscos . You will then spend the night at your cozy villa, which will be a five-star accommodation in Ica's countryside.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Tour of Miraflores and the Barranco District
dayInfo.description: Birds may let out their early morning songs as the sun's rays burst through your window’s blinds. Today, you will board your private ground transportation and make your way back to Lima. The majority of your day will be spent alongside your expert guide for a more in-depth look at the invigorating neighborhoods of Miraflores and the Barranco District. Your tour will begin at water's edge in the charming neighborhood of Miraflores. Here, pristine white skyscrapers line the cliffside, and paragliders often glide to the sandy beaches. You will begin with a stroll through the scenic gardens of Park Grau, which are punctuated with palm trees that hug the cliffside. Then, your guide will lead you to the towering Miraflores Lighthouse, which was rebuilt as a replica of an original 1900 lighthouse in the city of Punta Coles. Finally, you can meander through the Parque del Amor, which is marked by a renowned, central statue of an enamored couple that is wrapped in an intimate embrace. Not only is this frequent destination for couples, but this park is also beloved by tourists and locals alike because of its beautifully tiled mosaic benches that provide the perfect sunset vantage point. In the afternoon, your tour guide will lead you to the electric hues of the Barranco District. Here, vibrant facades of buildings and whimsical street art are highlighted against the concrete. The central bridge, which is known at Puente de los Suspiros, boasts the best views for pedestrians who meander through the city's downtown. When hunger strikes, you can settle into a quaint, outdoor cafe as you overlook Barranco's downtown.

dayInfo.title: Pachacamac District – Exploration of Ancient Civilizations and Ecotourism
dayInfo.description: While the buzzing energy of modern life is in full swing in the nation's capital, hints of a storied past are also tucked behind nearly every corner, spanning thousands of years. Remnants of ancient civilizations, even those that pre-date the Inca Empire, exude from every corner. Despite the Spanish conquest of the 16th and 17th centuries, many of these relics remain largely intact. You will visit one such example on today's trip to the Pachacamac District. This archaeological site along the Lurin River has been inhabited since as early as 200 AD. Here, you can tour the massive compound of this ancient civilization. Shallow stone steps of the Temple of the Sun span 30,000 meters and will lead you to the former site of ritualistic offerings. Here, you can take a look at the Tauri Chumbi Palace, Calle Norte Sur , and the carefully constructed gravesites. In the afternoon, you will experience the best of Peru's ecotourism. Considered one of the most geographically diverse regions in the world from towering mountain peaks to low-lying valleys and from grassy plains and sparkling coastlines to the hidden wonders of the Amazonian Jungle, Peru is an ideal location for a scenic hike among luscious green foliage. You will venture to Lomas de Lucumo, where you can trek through the dense cloud forest along well-established trails. You should also keep watch for bursting flowers, mossy green cliff sides, and hilly terrain. At the peak of the rainy season, a mystic fog may descend on the region and beckon you to indulge in a closer look. At each bend in the road, new beauties are unveiled. In the evening, you will return to Lima for your final evening in the city. Water's edge will set the scene for an idyllic last night in the city while you bite into citrusy ceviche and sip on sweet chica morada juice.

dayInfo.title: Lima – International Flight Connections
dayInfo.description: As your journey comes to a close, you can enjoy one last cup of mate de coca tea from atop your balcony or at a nearby open-aired cafe. You will breathe in the salty seaside air and let the cool breeze wash over you. By mid-morning, your private transfer will arrive at your hotel and accompany you to the Jorge Chavez International Airport, where you will connect to your international flight home.

tourName: In-Depth Family Tour to Lima, Peru
placesVisited: Lima, Huacachina, Aguas Calientes, Machu Picchu, Cusco
generalInfo: You and your family will keep up with the hustle and bustle of vivacious city life in Peru's capital. Taxi cabs and city buses weave through traffic as they pass by looming skyscrapers and the crashing Pacific Ocean waves. Street vendors call out daily specials against colorful facades that highlight a vibrant backdrop of bursting street art. Follow your expert guide on a customized tour of the city's past and present before venturing to the city outskirts for an unparalleled adrenaline rush across the undulating sand dunes of Huacachina. Your amazing, 7-day adventure through Peru will culminate with a summit to the famed ruins of Machu Picchu, which will be everything you imagined and much more.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Airport Arrival and Sunset Dinner
dayInfo.description: Sparkling shorelines beckon travelers from all over the world to the picturesque city of Lima. Gulls may hover over deep blue waters, hoping for the perfect catch, and couples will lay out blankets as they soak up the sun and dip their toes into the Pacific Ocean. As you and your family coast down the tarmac of Jorge Chávez International Airport, you will be met with the tantalizing aromas of Peru's citrusy ceviche . The cool ocean breeze will wash over you as you deplane, and soon, you will meet your private transfer who will wind you through city streets to your luxurious accommodation. Your car will bump along cobbled streets as you appreciate the alluring architecture, which is a unique blend of ancient and post-colonial styles. Along the coast, skyscrapers punctuate the city skyline, and just minutes inland, ancient stone temples lay in hiding. Before long, you will arrive at your luxurious hotel in the heart of Miraflores. This opulent neighborhood is home to modern design, prestigious restaurants, upscale apartments, and breathtaking vistas. Together, you and your family can stroll through the picturesque Parque del Amor as sunset warms the evening sky. Then, you will choose from a plethora of authentic dining options with boastful seaside views. Your waiter will offer you a delectable choice of pickled escabeche or perfectly seasoned lomo saltado and a frothy glass of pisco sour to commemorate the first night of your jam-packed family adventure in Peru.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Tour of City Highlights and Scenic Bike Ride
dayInfo.description: Coos of early morning birds and the lulls of light traffic will begin to stir in the morning. Shop owners will converse with one another as they set up for the day, and street vendors will make their way to the central plazas that are full of heavy foot traffic and potential customers. You will begin your morning with a fresh cup of mate de coca herbal tea, which is an ancient Peruvian custom that is used in spiritual practices and is also said to boost energy. Your expert guide will meet you in front of your hotel for an up-close look of the city highlights. Your tour will begin beneath the shady palm trees of the Plaza de Armas, which is a beautiful public square that is complete with ornate stone fountains and flanked with the bright yellow walls of the Municipal Palace of Lima. Stark white balconies and arched facades are a clear indication of Spanish post-colonial design, and pink hues of the Basilica and Convent of Santo Domingo will burst into view as you stroll through the church's courtyard, which is decorated with electric red arches. Finally, you and your family will arrive at the Torre Tagle Palace and marvel at the intricate woodwork of the balconies that rise out over the quaint cobbled streets. In the afternoon, a customized paragliding class will take your family adventure to new heights. You will learn the basic mechanics alongside an expert instructor, and after you have mastered the basic mechanics, you will indulge in an exhilarating descent in tandem with a professional paraglider as you soar from the rocky cliffside to the sandy beaches below. It is a once-in-a-lifetime experience with stunning views to match. For families with young children or those who are looking for alternative activities, you can enjoy a beautiful bike ride along the coastline where you can stop for pictures and travel to the splendid beaches of Costa Verde or Playa Mar Brava. After this exciting adventure, you will be returned to your hotel, where you will have the rest of the evening at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Sand Dune Buggy Ride and Lunch at Desert Oasis
dayInfo.description: Undulating sand dunes glisten under the hot Peruvian sun and convene at a central oasis of refreshing lagoon water. Today, you will break away from Lima for the day while keeping up with the adventurous spirits of yesterday's thrill ride. Here, in Huacachina, you and your family will be provided the adrenaline rush of a lifetime as you whiz up and down the dunes in an all-terrain buggy that will be suited for your whole family. Your expert driver will lead you over magnificent arches and around seemingly impossible bends, and you can catch your breath at the summit of a few dunes while you snap some truly unique family photos. After a few hours, your kids will delight in a private sandboarding class with an expert instructor. This is completely safe, and parents are welcome in on the hair-raising fun as well. It is all about keeping a steady balance as you coast down the steep dunes at hurdling speeds, and the rest of your afternoon offers a chance to cool off with a freshly squeezed fruit juice and light lunch beside the oasis lagoon. You can bite into fresh local fruits like the milky white chirimoya or the vibrant fruit that is locally known as maracuya . In the evening, your private transport will return you back to Lima for some self-paced exploration of the downtown and enchanting public parks along the periphery. Later, you can relax at the water's edge or venture downtown for a hearty meal on one of the numerous outdoor patios.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Tour of Miraflores and Barranco District
dayInfo.description: Beyond the city center, life flows at a slower pace. Pedestrians tend to stop to admire the beautiful architecture of the Barranco District while sitting on park benches to marvel at the beauty of the natural landscapes in Miraflores. Your day will begin alongside your knowledgeable guide in the Barranco District. As soon as you arrive, you will be met with the juxtaposition of lively street art, eccentric-colored buildings, and the calming atmosphere of downtown. The Puente de los Suspiros boasts unparalleled views of the bright facades in stark contrast to the muted tones of brick-laid streets. Afterward, you can stroll down Avenida Saenz Pena, which is lined with colonial mansions, as you learn about the history of Lima's elite in this region. Then, you will sample authentic Peruvian coffee at a nearby cafe before delighting in a light lunch at an open-aired cafe. In the afternoon, you will be led a scenic ride along the coastline as you breathe in the salty seawater. Soon, you will circle back to Miraflores, which is perhaps the most prestigious neighborhood in all of Peru and is marked by towering white skyscrapers that rise into the sky. Then, you will follow your guide to some of the most enchanting parks that can be found here in Miraflores. Next, you will stroll through the gardens of Parque Grau and wind down the paths of Parque del Amor while lovers sit on beautifully tiled, mosaic benches and peer out onto the sunset. Finally, you and your family will visit the stoic Miraflores Lighthouse, which was built as a replica of the original lighthouse and was completed in the year 1900 at Punta Coles. Afterward, you will be returned to your luxurious hotel, where you can relax and choose how you spend the remainder of your evening.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – UNESCO Machu Picchu Ruins
dayInfo.description: A distant journey from Lima's coastline lies among the looming Andes mountain range and the mystic Sacred Valley. You will be venturing to the breathtaking beauty of Peru's very own Machu Picchu. Millions of travelers make the trek each year to the famed UNESCO World Heritage Site, which is among the best-preserved relics in all of the Inca Empire. Early in the morning, you will board a short flight from Lima to Cusco, which is considered the birthplace of the Inca Empire. Here, you can explore the famed Plaza de Armas and peruse several open-aired markets. Then, you can enjoy a light lunch in the city's downtown before sipping on a fresh cup of mate de coca as you adjust to the climb in altitude, which moves from sea level to nearly 11,000 feet. Soon after, you will board a luxurious train ride with panoramic views of the stunning terrain. You and your family can look out the side windows and the glass ceiling as you snake along the Urubamba River. You will traverse wooden bridges and pass grassy farmland that glistens beneath the sun's rays. Soon, you will arrive in the sleepy town of Aguas Calientes, which is located at the base of the ruins. You will then settle into your luxury accommodation with its idyllic balcony views of the winding river and protruding mountain peaks.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – Machu Picchu, Huayna Picchu, and Hot Springs
dayInfo.description: You and your family will be met by your guide in the early morning in front of your hotel. Together, you will board private transportation and weave up the steep roads en route to the famed ruins. Through cracked windows, you can begin to breathe in the fresh mountain air, and as you make the final ascent, you will be met by the wonder of these majestic ruins. You will explore the ruins and learn about key features that include The House of the Guards, the Royal Tombs, The Temple of Three Windows, Plaza Principal, and Sacred Rock. In the evening, you and your family will return to the serenity of Aguas Calientes as the horizon softens and dusk blankets over this sleepy town. You can make your way from your luxury hotel to the well-known hot springs, which are the namesake of the town. You will submerge yourselves in the steamy waters that are said to contain medicinal healing as you breathe in the fresh air and sweet aromas of the surrounding foliage. You can marvel at the surrounding mountain tops and iridescent river waters that rush past. Then, you can return to your accommodation at night before indulging in a delicious local three-course meal.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Airport Departure and Connect to International Flights
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will board a luxury train that will take you from Aguas Calientes to Cusco. Soon, you will arrive in Poroy and meet your transportation that will return you to Cusco. From there, you will catch your regional flight back to Lima and then connect to your international flight home.

tourName: Inca Trail to Machu Picchu Tour
placesVisited: Cusco, Machu Picchu, Lima, Inca Trail
generalInfo: Follow the spectacular road of history on this magnificent tour of the Inca Trail. You will savor the wealth of the ruins and the beauty of the Andes. The footsteps of the Inca traverse mountains, stretch along rivers, and wander through jungle. The ruins decorate the mountains above and the valleys below and the treasure of Machu Picchu stands waiting to be sought. Each step is a wonder, each view offers a panorama of majesty, and the Inca Trail brings you to such great heights.

dayInfo.title: Lima – The Lima Seaside
dayInfo.description: Arrive in Lima, considered to be the City of Kings. The grandeur of the city sits within its diversity as the neighborhoods stretch along the expanse of the ocean. The air smells of the sweet sea and citrus, while each neighborhood adds a rich layer to the city’s eclectic wonder. Wander through the city and experience the splendor first hand with a visit to the Church of San Francisco. The yellow façade looks like the sun shining bright against the open blue sky. The church bells peel through the air and give a singing quality to the city. Enter the church and find the exuberant tile lining the walls, streaks of white and red climbing into the archways and circling the dome. Follow a guide into the depths of the church where the lights flicker like torches giving you a sense of adventurous exploration. The catacombs are damp and heavy with the rich history within the city. The stones are cold to the touch. The sound of shoes against dirt paths lingers in the air. The various tombs run along the walls and a large tomb sits within the confines of a deep, wide well-like structure. Continue your exploration of history with a visit to the trendy seaside neighborhood of Miraflores. The Calle de Pizza emanates the scent of baked dough and melted cheese. Meander along the outskirts and find the stunning remains of Huaca Pucllana. The adobe bricks are stacked and tiered, making the pyramid look like an optical illusion, winding up and around each brick into the sky and the ground simultaneously. Wander amongst the bricks where you can see the modern city of Lima rising in the background, a reminder of the modern city siting atop fantastic history. The night brings with it the gentle glow of the pyramid in the spotlights bringing the ancient wonders to golden life against the starry night and lulling waves.

dayInfo.title: Inca Trail – Ascending to Great Heights
dayInfo.description: Today you will transfer to Cusco and begin your sensational journey through the Andes along the Inca Trail. Step beside the rushing water of the Urubamba River, the white rush winding along the foothills of the valley. The scent of fresh water and morning dew slips into the air. Across the bridge you will step foot onto the ancient trail and walk with the legends through the Sacred Valley. Mountains stretch to the horizon while the sounds of the river start to recede in the distance. The trail begins flat, the grass tall and lush, but the hills start to slope and you come to a large clearing at the top, looking down into a serene valley. Your guide stops you and gives a prayer and sweet offering of candy to Pachamama, the Andean earth mother. With your offering accepted and the cool breeze rolling over the grass, your guide points down to Llaqtapata, standing over 9,000 feet above sea level, and you look upon the Incan ruins atop the plateau below. The ruins sit on a small citadel above a terraced hill that slopes deeper in the valley creating tiers along the foothill. The landscape is majestic, with the earthen stones standing against the vibrant green floor as the hills wind and wrap into one another. Venture into the ruins to see the Incan remains up close. The stones are cool on your hand while the grass is warm from the sun. The vegetation of the surrounding canyon stretch along the ruin floor giving you a taste of Indiana Jones in a wild lush world where if you didn’t know what you were looking for you may have never found it.

dayInfo.title: Inca Trail – The Length of the Trees and the Receding Lush
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the scent of rich coffee in the cold of the dawn. Wrap your hands around the hot cup and let the scent and flavor warm the morning. Continue your venture along the Inca Trail where you can walk in serenity listening to the sound of rolling rivers and tumbling waterfalls and imagine the footsteps of the Incans that have walked the trail before you. Stroll beneath the canopy and the endless green is decorated with blossoming pink orchids. The beautiful lull of rushing water meanders over the jungle floor, while the brush is blanketed with moss and wildflowers that give the irresistible scent of potpourri against fresh water. Rise above the rain forest where arid mountaintops sit over the canopy, llamas and donkeys grazing along the puna , a high altitude plant that grows in the craggy, mountain soil. The snowy peak of Mount Veronica pierces the distant sky. You can see a part of the Cloud Forest below, where the fog nestles among the trees looking like a blanket that can’t quiet cover a room filled with cones. Breathe deep as the sun settles behind the mountains, the scent of delicious hot chocolate surrounding you and getting you ready for another night beneath the stars.

dayInfo.title: Inca Trail – Amongst the Clouded Trees
dayInfo.description: The sun rises over the valley and brings the morning calls of birds echoing through the foothills. The trees rustle in the early cold as the shadows from the night begin to disappear. The lush space of Llulluchapampa is behind you as you continue your adventure through the Andes. The mountain air is fresh in your lungs as you wander higher into the hills, venturing over the highest pass on the trail, Warmihuañusca, also known as Dead Woman’s Pass, reaching a height of almost 13,800 feet above sea level. The rough rocks and stone steps of the trail urge you forward. Once at the top you can see the open valley that you have crossed so far and the mountain you have undoubtedly climbed. The vines open and give a view of the stunning Phuyupatamarca ruins, standing against the hillside with the valley sitting far below. From the proper angle it looks like the ruins are cut in half, coming to a steep angle along the tiered mountain. The view of the mountain peaks stand tall in the distant sky while the valley becomes almost invisible. The stones of the city’s remains are covered in moss and time. Witness the grandeur of the craft by walking along paths that are semi-detached from the mountain, where rocks fill up ravines in perfect order saving the trail from the undulating Andean hills. Your campsite is already cleared and ready for you with the rich scent of pumpkin soup, your first course for the evening, drifting along the plateau. The night blankets the sky, stars glimmering over the mountainside as if winking.

dayInfo.title: Inca Trail – The Sun Lights the Gate
dayInfo.description: The early morning darkness fades into the morning orange light peaking behind the mountains. Today you will depart from the plateau of Phuyupatamarca ruins and descend deeper into the valley. The lush jungle once again surrounds you. The stone steps undulate from steep to shallow. You can hear the flutter of hummingbirds and see the colorful waft of butterfly wings. Come to the stunning edges of Wiñaywayna, the biggest archaeological site along the Inca Trail. Terraces climb the impressive mountain landscape, where a sliver of the Urubamba River can be seen twisting through the trees. A plateau within the climbing agricultural tiers holds the towering ruins consisting of an impressive complex where a religious sector and an urban sector are divided. Your journey along the trail continues, over the steep steps that run along the mountainside, climbing higher, once again, over the valley below. Reach the top of the steps where the jungle opens suddenly. The wash of the sky spreads over the mountaintops. Stone pillars stand in front of you, the remains of the Sun Gate. Step forward and you look out over the breathtaking view of the Lost City of Machu Picchu, where the sun shines along the dew, the stone remains stand high over the valley, and panorama is something out of a painting; you almost pinch yourself to make sure it’s real. Within the city traverse the grounds and experience the history within Intihuatana , the “hitching post of the sun.” It is the rock pillar known as the sundial that stands atop the Intihuatana hill. Inca astronomers predicted solstices using the angles of this pillar to help control the coming summer days.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Found the City in the Sky
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the morning sun lingering over the mountaintops and spreading light along the valley floor. Venture once again onto the plateau where the remarkable city of Machu Picchu stands. The surreal glow of the grass, the climbing terraces of the mountainside, and the stretch of the stone buildings are as breathtaking today as ever. The morning stands strong over the Lost City and you stretch your legs one more time to reach the towering peak of Huayna Picchu. With only 200 visitors allowed per day, you make your way to the entrance of the looming mountain and begin your ascent. The stone stairs meander beside the rocky cliff, twisting and turning with each step. The hard climb ended days ago, however, this climb seems the last challenge along a series of wonders. You reach the peak of the mountain, look down onto the Lost City and understand the magnificence and grandeur of standing amongst mountaintops and over Machu Picchu. The city shines below, a scaled down model of the ruins you walked through, but no less magical, and all the more personal. You will make your way down the mountains, through the Lost City, onto a train to return to Cusco but for now…just enjoy the view.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Such Great Heights
dayInfo.description: Today you leave the wonders of the Andes behind and wave goodbye to the Inca Trail. Your time in Peru has brought you to spectacular heights, from beneath the grounds of the Church of San Francisco to standing above the Lost City, where it felt like even birds wouldn’t dare to fly. The exceptional sights of ruins strewn across the mountainside and orchids blossoming beneath the jungle canopy will never be less than majestic. Fly through the clouds, over the remnants of the Inca Trail, where you will always remember such great heights.

tourName: Incan Exploration: Immersive 10-Day Peru Itinerary
placesVisited: Lima, Miraflores, Borranco, San Isidro, Costa Verde, Huaca Pucllana, Puerto Maldonado, Reserva Amazonica, Madre do Dios River, Tambopata National Reserve, Gamitana, Hacienda Concepcion, Butterfly House, Urubamba Valley (Sacred Valley of the Incas), Pisac, Maras, Moray, Ollantaytambo, Machu Picchu, Huayna Picchu, Cusco, Qorikancha, Sacsayhuaman
generalInfo: Howler monkeys curl their tails while hooting an Amazonian call. Quechua women in colorful dress wander past sturdy Incan fortresses. The sun rises above the world-renowned Machu Picchu, and it sets behind the rainforest and sacred valley. Peru is a land of rich natural and cultural highlights, many of which are hidden away and are only recently becoming known to visitors. This ten-day tour combines the best of these with the country’s finest hotels, going from the Amazon to the Andes in five-star luxury.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Relaxed Arrival and Seafood
dayInfo.description: Lima is all bustle and noise at first glance. It is a sprawling city of tightly-packed neighborhoods, where many centuries of architecture stand side by side. You will be staying in Miraflores, which is a contemporary suburb along the Pacific Ocean and the epicenter of what has become an internationally acclaimed culinary scene. They do seafood differently here. Specifically, a form of Japanese Peruvian fusion known as Nikkei. After an airport transfer and some time to relax at the hotel, you will have dinner reservations at one of the World’s Top 50 Restaurants, which will be a great place to start feeling Peru and the experiences that it can provide.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Old and New Highlights in the City of Kings
dayInfo.description: Peru is eclectic and evocative as there is so much more to Lima’s neighborhoods than what initially greets the eye. Artisans will have their workshops down republican-era streets, and local hole-in-the-wall food joints will be juxtaposed with glass-dominated skyscrapers. On a grand plaza, you will find colonial palaces along with local traders that sell cotton candy and balloons. Today’s private tour will plot a path through these neighborhoods, dipping into a few iconic attractions, but mostly showcasing the daily life of the Limenos , the residents of Lima residents. You will pass bohemian streets to traditional markets, wander along the coast, dine on lunchtime ceviche (raw fish marinated with lemon juice), and find a pre-Inca temple before ending in a neighborhood with full of olive groves. While this may sound like a lot for one day, the beauty of Lima is how everything is neatly packed together.

dayInfo.title: Reserva Amazonica – Beneath the Lush Jungle Canopy
dayInfo.description: Even on the jungle’s outskirts, you can feel that wildlife is near. After a one-hour motorboat ride, this feeling will grow stronger. After flying to Puerto Maldonado, you will travel by water to Reserva Amazonica, a wild yet very accessible part of the famous jungle. Built in an indigenous architectural style, your lodge is perched on a river beneath a lush canopy of Shihuahuaco trees. You will be connected to nature here while still enjoying most Western comforts. Most importantly, you will enjoy all the space and privacy that the Amazon effortlessly creates. You will check into the lodge and take your first wilderness foray this afternoon. A guide will lead you along a trail of 160-foot trees, past strangler figs, and up to canopy viewpoints. They will also show you the rambunctious monkeys and take your bird watching if you desire. You will return to the lodge for sunset before taking a different trail after dark.
