The calm rush of water laps beneath the walkway. You can sit in the quiet ends of the city and know that adventure has just begun.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Transfer to the Incan Capital City of Cusco
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart from the sprawling cultural neighborhoods of Lima and arrive in Cusco, some 10,750 feet above sea level, nestled within the lush beauty of the Andes, the longest mountain range in the world. Cusco is filled with Andean culture and sentiment, spread across the reflective facades of the Spanish colonial buildings and built on top of Incan remains. Children rush along the streets with soccer balls and squirt guns, their laughter bouncing off of the walls of a colonial past. The rich scent of Peruvian coffee lingers longer than the children. Tour through the city to experience the deluxe wonders of the city, from the Plaza de Armas to the surrounding ruins. Sacsayhuaman is the Incan fortress that looks over the city like a petulant ghost. The large monoliths were cut and pushed together, giving the walls a forceful and breathtaking look, having stood for centuries without any mortar. The rich trees that surround the city give a pleasant minty aroma to the afternoon. Enter the fortress and walk deeper into the Incan remains, along the long stretch of large boulders that guide you almost to the distant tree line. The fortress looks like it could have been a second city overlooking the Incan capital of Cusco, and meant to be the head of the puma, created by the shape of fortress and the city combined. The fortress is air musky with fresh earth and rich stone. The boulders rise over 30 feet in places, dwarfing you and leaving you to wonder how the Incas had managed such a tremendous structure. Venture through the fortress, along and on top of the boulders to see the city below. The cool breeze brushes your cheeks. Mountains surround Cusco and homes rise up the sloping foothills. Upon your exploration of the fortress you will also find the natural stone slides. The stones have smoothed and angle down the hillside in tiers inviting you to glide down and touch the ground. The wind whips through your hair, the stone is cool on your fingertips, and the ground comes up to greet you, giving you one more rush within a day full of wonders.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Explore Pisac and Ollantaytambo
dayInfo.description: Today you will venture into the Sacred Valley to experience the culture of the Andes and the surviving structures of the Incas. The Pisac ruins are separated into four sections, each one unique in its structure and position. The fortress sits along a rocky outcrop giving view to the surrounding valley, while the Sun Temple is made of rock that glows red in the afternoon light. The air is perfumed with fresh fruit and Peruvian mint called huacatay . The sensational color shines over the hillside like a second sun. Venture into the Pisac Market where the vivacious colors of the local textiles are as vibrant as a rainbow. The cloth is soft and smooth to the touch. The blankets are warm while the hats range from wide-brimmed to beanies. From the steps of the Pisac Market to the steps of Ollantaytambo village, you can see the remains of an Incan city overlaid by an Andean village. The quintessential doorway is made of polished wood, surrounded by a variety of stones smoothed and cut with a trapezoidal archway, layered and leading to the door keeping the homes a consistent temperature year-round. Ollantaytambo sits beneath an engraved image of Viracocha built into the mountainside and is known as the great creator in Incan mythology.

dayInfo.title: Machu Picchu - Through the Sacred Valley to Machu Picchu
dayInfo.description: The Urubamba Valley stretches beneath the stunning Andes, the peaks rolling through the sky as the river tumbles along the foothills. Mist sprays into the air. The grass sways in the breeze. You reach the base of the Lost City of the Incas and you are ready to explore. The cool clouds dissipate in the late morning warmth. The fields begin to shimmer in the light. Climb the stone stairs and feel the adrenaline rush to your muscles with each step. You come closer to one of the Seven Wonders of the World. Each step is even beneath your feet until you reach the top. The city of ruins spreads before you along the plateau, over various terraces, and onto the foothills of Huyana Picchu, the towering mountain in the short distance. You take a deep breath and can almost taste your excitement. Stairs take you on top of tiers, temples wind around the mountainside. The Condor Temple is a mixture of stone blocks overlooking the polished cliff side and stained rock. Descend into the temple where a rock shaped like a condor sits at the heart of where the entire temple once stood. The enormity of the Lost City is not just in its size but within its survival.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Explore the Ruins of Machu Picchu
dayInfo.description: The morning brings with it a wondrous radiance over the Lost City. Venture back onto the citadel where the wonders of Machu Picchu have and will remain along the plateau amongst the clouds. The morning dew drifts into the air. The cool breeze brushes through your hair. Explore one of the secret entrances to Machu Picchu, one of the reasons why the incredible city had been lost and remained unscathed for centuries, along the Inca Bridge. The cliff shines pink and red between the sprouting trees. The bridge consists of the trunk bridge, a stone path that cuts into the rugged cliff face that had a large piece missing, meant to leave the trail impassable for strangers. The rock face is rugged and course against your palms but the view is incredible offering an untouched expanse of the valley combined with the history of the hidden pathway to a city in the clouds. After your exploration of the bridge, you will make your way to the train station and return to Cusco, settling into the luxurious comforts of your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Boca Manu - Depart for the Manu Wildlife Center
dayInfo.description: Today you will say goodbye to the Andes and the beautiful city of Cusco. Make your way to the airport and watch the mountaintops recede beneath you as venture to the secluded Amazon basin arriving in Boca Manu. The air surrounds you with warmth as you stand on the banks of the Amazon River. Parrots caw and the sound echoes in the trees. Climb aboard a motor taxi that will take you through the Madre de Dios River and into the sensational and private Manu Wildlife Center. Journey through the dense and lush rainforest around the wildlife center. The gentle trickle of water sits beneath the canopy. The leaves rustle above you. The air is still around you. Your guide points into the trees and you can see a monk saki lingering in the thick branches. The primate has a monk’s haircut and looks like a mini orangutan with a long tail and black fur. After a decadent dinner within the trees you will make your way to the clay lick, climb up along the 17 feet observation center and watch the lumbering tapirs waddle to the clay. The tapir looks like a mixture between a large pig and a small anteater, and makes a high-pitched grunting sound as it lumbers through the forest. With the rich night sky shining through the canopy, you savor the wonders of the ruins and the rainforest in your mind.

dayInfo.title: Boca Manu - Traverse the Sensational Sights of Manu Wildlife Center
dayInfo.description: The dawn brings with it the active life of the rainforest as the birds begin to sing beneath the canopy. The morning air is cool against your skin; the wildlife center is perfumed with aromatic coffee and freshly fallen rain. Journey to the famous parrot clay lick where the vibrant colors of the wild reveal themselves as if you were looking through a kaleidoscope. Macaws stand along the cliff; their mouths are perched on the mineral rich clay, as their bright red feathers blend with the iridescent blue that pops against the dull pink of the clay lick. Vines dangle above the clay and offer cover and comfort to the birds drifting in and out of the rainforest. The boisterous sounds of active birds bonce off of the rock face. Continue on to explore the oxbow lakes where giant otters glide through the water and Hoatzin linger in the trees. Hoatzins are a plump bird with a prehistoric twinge, looking like a mixture of turkey, a hawk, and a punk rocker with wings. Their wingspan is circular while their colors help them blend into the underbrush. The fabulous sights of the rainforest are sometimes hidden within the various hues that make the wildlife so beautiful.

dayInfo.title: Boca Manu - Enjoy the Natural Wonders of the Manu Wildlife Center
dayInfo.description: The hoots and cries of monkeys filter through the canopy at dawn bringing another unique experience in the rainforest. Follow your guide through the lush jungle for a visit to a stunning variety of fruit trees that grow in the forest, from fig trees that wrap around their host like a parasite, giving them the name strangler fig trees, to the raspberry red insides of the Titoki tree. As you wander beneath the canopy your guide tells you to stop. They point into the distance and you can make out bright spots sitting on top of a log. It’s a jaguar sunning itself along the forest floor. Her spots stand out against the branch, her eyes a piercing yellow. You follow your guide away from the jaguar, relish the rare sight, and can once again hear the monkeys howling within the trees.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Return to the Beauty of the Andes at Cusco
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart the Manu Wildlife Center along the waters of the Madre de Dios River. From the boat, you can hear the caws and calls of the various birds in the trees. Kingfishers swoop into the water to catch breakfast. Fish leap from the water to catch flying bugs. The river is warm as you dip your fingertips beneath the surface; the water teems with life and the air is filled with the buzz of insects and the howl of monkeys. Venture to the airport for a return trip to Cusco. Once you arrive in the mountain top city of the once Inca capital, your adventure through the rainforest will have come to an end, but there is always more to explore and experience along the rambling cobblestones of Cusco. The mountain breeze is cool around you. The aroma of cold stone and roasted sweet potato fills the streets. Venture to Plaza San Blas for a quiet and serene taste of the city above the rooftops. Much of the spirit of Peru sits within its national drink, the Pisco Sour, where the frothy texture mixes with the floral scent and the tangy flavor for a complex and tasty combination, just like Peru itself.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: Today you will make your way out of Cusco where you will connect to your flight home in Lima. The sensational sights of Peru stretch across the metropolis of Lima, from the foothills of the Andes, and into the Amazon Basin. You traveled through clouds and found the Lost City of Machu Picchu. You ventured into the rainforest to see the vivacious shades of macaws and the secret wilds of the hidden Amazon. The modernity of Lima rolled through the diversity of the neighborhoods. Your time in Peru brought you more than just an adventure, it brought you an imaginative world full of memories to return to time and again.

tourName: Peru's Treasured Past: Fascinating 8-Day History Tour
placesVisited: Lima, Cusco, Machu Picchu/Aguas Calientes, Pisco, Nazca, Paracas
generalInfo: This customizable 8-day Peru tour offers a glimpse of one of the most fascinating cultures in the world. The mystic Andes Mountains conceal secrets of centuries past and riveting tales of the Inca Empire. Beauty exudes from every crevice of the whimsical Sacred Valley, and palaces, cathedrals, and open-aired markets dot the vivacious city streets of Cusco and Lima. Book your trip of a lifetime today.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Touchdown in Lima
dayInfo.description: As soon as you touch down in Lima, you will be serenaded by the sweet melodies of authentic Peruvian music. Shortly after your private driver greets you, they will transfer you to your accommodation in the Miraflores neighborhood. You can enjoy a few leisurely hours to unwind in your room before venturing to the city center. You will truly get a feel for the local culture this evening by dining at the water's edge. You can top off the night with a traditional glass of Peru's national drink, pisco sour, as you look out at surfers and paragliders before settling in for the night.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Ancient Inca Ruins
dayInfo.description: Today, you will venture to the beautiful city of Cusco. Here, your guide will lead you to some of the city's most impressive Inca ruins of Tambomachay and Saqsaywaman. You will also discover irrigation systems that were used by Inca nobility as a water source for the city of Cusco and to create spa-like baths. In the evening, you will descend on Cusco's main Plaza de Armas. Alongside your guide, you will sample some of the region's most exquisite culinary delights, including cuy, or guinea pig.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – World Heritage Ruins of Machu Picchu
dayInfo.description: Today, you will embark on a journey to the famed ruins of Machu Picchu. This UNESCO World Heritage site hosts millions of admirers each year. You will surely see why when your guide leads you on a customized tour of the ruins. As you stare out onto the Andean Mountain range, you can marvel at the power and might that was required to construct the citadel in such an isolated location. You will then explore some of Machu Picchu's most illustrious features, such as the Sacred Rock, the Royal Tomb, and the Temple of Three Windows, before having the chance to climb Huayna Picchu.

dayInfo.title: Pisco – Pisco Sour Tasting Event
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, you will transfer to the shimmering coastlines of Pisco. Here, you can indulge the magic of the nation's most prized national drink. For years, Peru and its southern neighbor, Chile, have been engaged in a lively debate over who can claim the citrusy drink as their own. You will soon see why this drink is such a crowd-pleaser. As you sit at a table that overlooks the Pacific, you will follow along on a guided tasting of several varieties of pisco sour . In the evening, you can enjoy some rest and relaxation on the sandy shores as the sun begins to set.

dayInfo.title: Nazca – Helicopter Tour of Nazca Lines
dayInfo.description: Today, you will take to the skies with a helicopter ride. Your flight will lead you over Peru's Nazca Lines for the best vantage point. Your expert guide will share some information about these unique designs and geometric patterns that offer insight into Inca and pre-Inca civilizations. You will also learn more about the various theories of how they came to be. In the afternoon, you will tour the city's municipal museum and dive deeper into the local heritage and folklore. You can also visit the Plaza de Armas.

dayInfo.title: Paracas – Scenic Tour of Islas Ballestas
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, your guide will escort you to a cruise that will lead you to the lovely city of Paracas. As you near the rocky island, you will soon be greeted by its eclectic residents, which include sea lions and a variety of bird species. You may even have the rare opportunity to see a humpback whale as it makes its way to warmer water. On the island, you can enjoy a seaside dinner along the beach.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Ceviche Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: During your final full day in Peru, you will return to the lively capital city of Lima. After settling in to your accommodation, your guide will lead you on a tour of the city center. You will begin in the vibrant Plaza de Armas, where the facades allude to the region's colonial past. Your tour will also include stops at a few of Lima’s public parks before concluding your tour in the Barranco District. In the late afternoon, you will participate in a ceviche cooking class with an expert chef.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Departure
dayInfo.description: In the early morning hours, you can enjoy a refreshing cup of cafe con leche with breakfast. You will then have a couple of hours for self-exploration along the coast or inside several local markets. Soon, you will have to return to your accommodation for your transfer to the airport.

tourName: Peruvian Amazon and Machu Picchu Tour Including Scenic Train Rides
placesVisited: Lima, Cusco, Machu Picchu, Puerto Maldonado
generalInfo: Your 10-day Peru highlights tour will uncover the beauty of the Andes and the splendors of the Amazon. Wander through the clouds while exploring Machu Picchu’s inspiring ruins. Cruise the Amazon River in search of vibrant parrots and active spider monkeys. Relax on a scenic train ride through the Sacred Valley. Wander the cobblestone maze of Cusco’s Spanish colonial history. Peru’s culture, scenery, and history will highlight remarkable diversity.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Collective Neighborhoods Create a City
dayInfo.description: Welcome to the Peruvian capital of Lima, where the eclectic city is nestled between the hot desert and the cool ocean. The beauty of the city sits within its balance of modernity and history, while skyscrapers reach beneath the clouds. Spanish remains glisten like gold within the confines of the historic center where the Government Palace stretches behind blossomed red and white carnations. Along the trendy neighborhood of Miraflores the soft ocean mist drifts over the boardwalk. Lovers Statue stands above the sand, beside the walkways, and watches over the sea with two lovers entwined and commemorated in stone. The evening sky brings with it the maritime mist and you settle into the soothing night of Lima.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Diversity Creates Majesty
dayInfo.description: Today you will transfer to Cusco where the capital city of Inca Empire sits comfortably between the rolling hills and towering mountains of the Sacred Valley. The air is crisp and thin within the altitudinal city. The cobblestone streets rise and fall with the hills, surrounded by Spanish architecture built along Inca foundation. Follow the narrow alleyways and vibrant facades that wind through the hills of the city and overlook the open space of the Plaza de Armas. From Plaza San Blas you can see the expanse of Cusco, the red rooftops and brick homes, the colorful buildings that climb the hillside, the scent of rich Peruvian coffee brewing from the Bar Lounge Café. On the mountaintop that lingers over the city the monoliths of Sacsayhuaman Fortress stare down onto Cusco like a protector. The stones were cut and pressed together, using their weight as mortar with such force that you’d be hard pressed to fit a blade of grass between the crevices of two boulders. Throughout the streets of Cusco you can see the diversity of the city, within its Incan past, its Spanish buildings, and the sounds of the pan flute sweeping over the cobblestones.

dayInfo.title: Ollantaytambo – Past Traditions Making Modern Times
dayInfo.description: Leave the city life behind and venture into the sensational culture of the Sacred Valley. The town of Pisac is filled with life during its vibrant market. The Andean colors are woven into the textiles giving each stall an explosion of pink, red, blue, yellow and more. The skirts twirl and move. Hats range from black and wide-brimmed to colorful and fringed. The scent of rich soups and juicy chicken drift through the market mixing with the jovial and boisterous customers before you depart for the town of Ollantaytambo. The town of Ollantaytambo is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in South America, with aqueducts that run through the village built by the Inca. The scent of lush grass and cold stone fills the village. The stone streets run along stone walls, and doorways are tiered, sealing the cracks, and keeping the home warm in the cold and cool in the heat. The ruins of ancient Ollantaytambo rise up the hillside with terraces stretching across and up the mountain. A single staircase divides the tiers until you reach the top where the remains of the grand temple continue to watch over the village. Part of the ruins is built into the mountain itself, shaded by the overhanging rock. From the vibrancy of the Pisac market to the ruins of Ollantaytambo you can see the diverse lives of the people, the history, and of Peru.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – The Modern Comforts of the Lost City
dayInfo.description: Climb aboard the train just outside of Cusco within the Sacred Valley and make your way to Aguas Calientes. The ride takes you along the valley floor beneath the rolling mountaintops. The train has a glass dome, open to beauty of the nature along the journey. The lively river sweeps beside and beneath the train. The fertile green of the valley gives way to the lavish dense jungle where you can see colorful orchids blossoming within the trees. Arrive at in Aguas Calientes at the base of Machu Picchu’s foothill. A short shuttle from the train will take you to the gates of the Lost City of Machu Picchu. Climb the stairs and feel your heat pulse with anticipation as you come one step closer to this Wonder of the World. The stairs come to a head along a terrace where you can see the remains of the city rise above you. The stones almost glisten in mid-morning light. The terraces climb up the mountainside from the valley below. Follow your guide along the citadel to explore the Lost City and its breathtaking stance within the mountains. Climb the stone staircase, above the ceremonial baths, along the short path that will lead you to the four-sided Sacred Plaza. From the curved wall on the far side you can see the snowcapped Cordillera Vilcabamba in the distance reminding you just how high in the mountains you are.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Clouds and Valleys
dayInfo.description: Today is at your leisure to explore the surroundings of Aguas Calientes where you can relax in the hot waters of the thermal baths with the natural rocky mountains surrounding you, or to venture back into the Lost City. Once more along the citadel of the city you can wander through the stone remains at your own pace and even venture out of the city all together, strolling along the stone footpath that will take you to the Temple of the Moon. Halfway down the Inca Road where the Inca Bridge is carved into the mountainside, you will find the temple covering the entire slopes of Huayna Picchu and consisting of architectural caves. The sloped terrain hovers over the temple like an inversed moon crater, holding the stone structure in place, or vice versa. Some of the stonework is decorated by niches and altars carved into the rock. As you exit the cave the scent of cool, shaded stone shifts to the crisp perfume of the high altitude plains. Climb aboard the train and enjoy the ride back to Cusco.

dayInfo.title: Amazon Rainforest – Mountain Ruins to Rainforest Rivers
dayInfo.description: Depart the gilded city of Cusco and rise above the Andes on your way to the natural wonder of the Amazon Rainforest. The trees settle beneath you like a never-ending carpet rolling along the riverbanks. Arrive in Puerto Maldonado where the gold mining and Brazil nut farming infrastructure of the city mixes with the rubber baron past. Flat canoes line the shore of the river and float through the water with ease. Follow your guide, step aboard a boat, and glide up river with the lush forest clamoring to the water’s edge. Keep your eyes open for the vibrant colors of macaws and the accentuated beak of toucans. The spectacular eco-lodge of Posada Amazonas sits inland from the river beneath the lush jungle canopy. The parrots call in the afternoon warmth and you can almost make out a dangling tail of a Capuchin monkey. Climb the scaffolding tower that rises over 100 feet into the trees and looks safely out into the jungle. The diversity of the Amazon is within its delicate, vibrant, and particular ecosystem. From the top of the tower you have a spectacular view of the river and the surrounding forest. Within the canopy you can see the glowing green feathers of parrots; their gruff, guttural call sits in the still air of the late afternoon. The floral scent of the trees rises into the sky and you have discovered the diversity of Peru, from the Andes to the Amazon, and within the rainforest itself.

dayInfo.title: Amazon Rainforest – Above the Trees and Around the Water
dayInfo.description: The morning light brings with it the wild calls of the jovial monkeys in the treetops. You wake to the pleasant aroma of rich coffee drifting through the forest. Today you will venture onto an easy canoe ride around Lake Tres Chimbadas for a tremendous wildlife safari. Giant river otters dip into the water, their fur slick with wet, until they return to shore and stretch out their lengthy bodies in the sun to dry. Turtles march along the banks, their spotted shells helping them blend into the moss and branches of the forest floor. You can hear the deep grunts and wheezes of the hoatzin, a bird that resembles a chicken with a punk-rock haircut. As the forest reaches the mid-afternoon the animal activity lessens and you venture onward to the Tambopata Research Center. Within the canopy of Tambopata the diversity of the rainforest can be seen immediately. Macaws and kingfishers are plentiful, swooping through the air with graceful color and musicality. A capybara, an adorable mammal that resembles a giant hamster, can be seen foraging along the forest floor. Enter the center grounds and enjoy a greeting from the flock of semi-wild, rescued macaws before venturing along the Bamboo Trail famous for the fabulous abundance of rare birds that live exclusively in southern Peru. The deep hoot of a howler monkey rumbles through the trees. You can see the iridescent turquoise feathers of jacamars, their long beaks like a hummingbird’s, but their color almost too bright to witness. The light turns to shadows within the forest and you return to the research center for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Amazon Rainforest – Colors Along the Clay
dayInfo.description: The dawn cool brings with it the colorful quiet of the rainforest as you cross the river to witness the world’s largest macaw clay lick. Step into the clearing where, beneath the vines that dangle above a small cliff, the pink clay rises. The morning sun spreads over the tree line and you can see groups of parrots and macaws sitting along the canopy, their vibrant feathers like tie-dye against the trees. The steep bank begins to pulse. Squawks and squabbles over mineral rich clay keeps feathers pumping, beaks biting, and claws gripping at the perch. The bright reds, greens, blues, and yellows of the fluttering birds sit along the cliff side until one senses danger, possibly an eagle. In almost one fluid motion the world explodes into color and sound, squawking and fluttering as the parrots and macaws simultaneously take to the air.

dayInfo.title: Amazon Rainforest – Along Rivers and Over Lakes
dayInfo.description: Today you will venture up river and return to the Posada Amazonas Lodge, leaving the rippling colors of the clay lick behind. Journey to the Oxbow Lake Short, a small drying waterway where you can view the natural wonders of the Amazon on a platform in the middle of the pond. The reflective water sits perfectly still until interrupted by ripples from the fish below. You can hear the aggressive drill of woodpeckers among the trees. Parakeets sing in the canopy. The wilds of the trees sway in the welcomed breeze and you can hear the rush of the river in the still of the later afternoon. Night begins to stretch above the canopy, the birds quiet down, the monkeys stop playing in the branches, and you settle in the lodge with the lingering perfume of camu-camu , a cherry-like fruit, filling the air.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Maldonado – From Here to There and Back Again
dayInfo.description: Today you will wade through the waters of Amazon Basin and return to Puerto Maldonado. The calls of macaws and prehistoric grunts of howler monkeys fade into the trees. Board your flight and watch the canopy disappear below. Your time in Peru gave you the wondrous variety of the Andes and the Amazon, where the mountains rolled and the trees surrounded you. Ruins decorated hills and birds adorned the cliffs. You witnessed the wonder of Machu Picchu and the majesty of the rainforest. You ventured through Peru and discovered how diverse it truly is.

tourName: Pure Peru: Amazon to Ancient Cusco Tour
placesVisited: Iquitos, Cusco, Lima, Machu Picchu and the Inca, Moray, Ollantaytambo
generalInfo: Book this immersive 11-day Peru tour to experience the adventures and heritage of Peru, from the Amazon to the Andes. The enchanting ruins of Machu Picchu feature soaring stones and sensational legends, and the dense jungle of the Amazon hides tremendous wildlife. Whether following the trails of the Inca or searching the water for signs of giant otters, you can indulge in the pure traditions, culture, and wonder of Peru with this trip.

dayInfo.title: Lima - Arrive in Vibrant Lima
dayInfo.description: Lima is a unique city that rises out of one of the driest places in the world. The city is home to coastal cliffs, pre-Columbian temples, and a unique display of Peru’s diverse heritage. Stately museums provide a sublime image of regional history and contemporary culture with displays of remarkable pottery and edgy art. Your flight will land at Lima’s Jorge Chavez International Airport, where your private transfer will meet you at customs. Once at your hotel, you can enjoy the day at your pace.

dayInfo.title: Iquitos - An Amazon Cruise
dayInfo.description: You will fly in the morning to the depths of the Amazon Rainforest at Iquitos, a city hidden in the jungle. The streets and bordering trees teem with life, the Belen Mercado shines with colorful displays inside the scores of huts along the water, and the rambling vendors feature floating canoes and trade exotic produce. Your private transfer will meet you at the airport and lead you to the comforts of your cruise that will lead you to the infamous Amazon River.

dayInfo.title: Amazon - Along the Amazon River
dayInfo.description: You will take a skiff over the Samiria River in the morning, during which your knowledgeable guide will explain the wonderful diversity of the ecosystem. You may hear the rowdy calls of the scarlet macaw in the trees, whose plumage shines with layers of red, yellow, and blue. Along the banks, you can search for giant river otters, which can grow up to over five and a half feet long. Their tail resembles a wing and helps them navigate the water so that they can hunt for fish and crabs.

dayInfo.title: Amazon - The Amazon and Piranha Fishing
dayInfo.description: You will set out into the jungles with your guide to discover the beauty and wild of your untamed surroundings. The cool morning air can reveal wildlife like the Woolly monkey, which can reach up to two feet long with an even longer tail. You will continue to a sheltered lagoon in search of a Hoatzin, a reclusive bird that is found in swamps and mangrove forests. Your guide will provide you with deeper insight into the history and ecology of the bird, and you will notice its large size of 26 inches tall.

dayInfo.title: Amazon - The Fundo Casual Jungle Trail
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will follow the Fundo Casual Trail into the dense Amazon Jungle while being surrounded by the exciting calls of the wild. You will reach the community of San Francisco, where you can visit the market to find local artisan crafts. The indigenous communities of the rainforest represent the preserved heritages and are coupled with elementary school initiatives. You can visit the community center to learn more about the curriculum and the traditions of the communities. After you reach the boat, you will venture back toward Iquitos with stoic scenery lining the waterways.

dayInfo.title: Sacred Valley - Finally Reach the Andes
dayInfo.description: Just outside of the city, your guide will lead you to the Amazon Rescue Center to experience the manatee conservation efforts. You can tour the facilities to find a number of pink dolphins and anteaters that were rescued and are in rehabilitation. The manatees can weigh up to nearly 764 pounds and use their flippers like hands to scoop the river floor, embrace another manatee, or guide food to their mouths. After visiting the manatee rehabilitation center, you will board a flight bound for Cusco, where your private transfer will drive you into the Andean countryside to the Sacred Valley.

dayInfo.title: Sacred Valley - Andean History and Culture
dayInfo.description: As you venture into the heritage of the Andes at Moray, you will discover the unique layers of Moray, where the terraced landscape resembles an amphitheater. The Incas used the varied features and temperatures of the layered platforms for agricultural purposes without the need for irrigation. When you reach Ollantaytambo, you will discover the fascinating Inca ruins that dominate the mountain slopes and hover above the town’s cobblestone streets. The fortress and temple stand atop a plateau with steep stairs that connect the tall terraces and texture the mountain.

dayInfo.title: Sacred Valley - The Secrets of Machu Picchu
dayInfo.description: You will travel to Machu Picchu in the morning to experience the hidden history that is shrouded by the atmospheric mist. The ruins represent the prestige of the former empire that was nearly forgotten for centuries. The ruins emerge from atop the Urubamba Valley, and your guide will lead you to the curved tower of stones that represent the Temple of the Sun. The Ceremonial Baths feature 16 connected ceremonial sections that cascade along the slopes. Your guide will provide a magnificent narrative of history and cultural throughout your journey together.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - The Charms of Cusco
dayInfo.description: The captivating city of Cusco acts as the capital of Andean culture. Here, the heritage of the mountains and Spanish colonial powers converge. You will meet your guide before enjoying a tour of the city’s diversity, from the ornate cathedrals to the cobblestone lanes. In Cusco, art galleries feature local artists, and boutiques display hand-woven alpaca sweaters. At Qorikancha, your guide will lead you through the former convent that was built over the Inca temple in the 15th century. The courtyard once featured a solid gold fountain.

dayInfo.title: Lima - Visit Piquillacta and Tipon
dayInfo.description: Today, you will follow your guide through the major pre-Inca ruins of Piquillacta in the morning to find the Wari cultural architecture that dates back nearly a millennium. Two-story structures create a unique ambiance among defensive walls with second-story entrances, and traces of gypsum remain on the floors and walls of the structures. You will continue to Tipon to find the picturesque set of terraces alongside long stairways. You can also find the remarkable irrigation system that crowns the head of the valley. After your tour, you will have a private transfer to the airport for your return flight to Lima.

dayInfo.title: Lima - Departure
dayInfo.description: Before your return flight home, you can enjoy the fascinating history and scenery of Lima. The electric ambiance of Miraflores stems from the beautiful cliffs that are lined with glass, steel architecture, and old colonial buildings. The sea breeze sweeps across the walkways and carries hang gliders over the edges of the Pacific Ocean. When you are ready, your private transfer will meet you at the hotel and escort you to the airport, bringing an end to your fascinating adventure in Peru.

tourName: Riveting Time Capsule Trip of Peru’s Capital
placesVisited: Lima, Caral, Nazca Lines, Paracas
generalInfo: Throughout this 7-day exploration of Peru’s history and culture, uncover some of the country's most treasured historical gems. Discover the ancient wonders of the stunning region of Lima, and fall in love with the friendly people, charming shops, delicious restaurants, and spectacular views. Amble through Lima's downtown, immerse yourself in the ancient civilizations of Caral, and fly over the enigmatic Nazca Lines.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Dinner on the Shoreline
dayInfo.description: As you touch down along the coastline of Peru's vivacious national capital, you will be greeted by your private transportation, who will transfer you to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of the city. Once you arrive at your opulent accommodation, you can settle in and catch a glimpse of the breathtaking ocean views from your private balcony. In the afternoon, you can venture into the city center for some self-guided exploration. You will have a chance to stroll through the pristine parks of Miraflores as the sun begins to set.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Ceviche Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, you will meet your expert guide for a customized tour of the city's downtown area. During your tour, you will delve into the local history while also coming to understand Lima as a point of national pride. Eventually, you will make your way to the Plaza de Armas, which is bursting with shady palm trees and vibrant facades of government buildings and palaces. Finally, your tour will conclude in the elite neighborhood of Miraflores. In the afternoon, you will join an expert chef in crafting one of Peru's most famous dishes: ceviche .

dayInfo.title: Lima – Visit Ancient Ruins
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will begin your day in the peaceful Parque del Amor, where couples gather to sit on mosaic benches and admire the view of the ocean. Afterward, you will enjoy a short bike ride along the coastline for the best views of the city. Soon, the Miraflores Lighthouse will unfold beyond a grassy hillside. In the afternoon, you will delve further into Peru's history as you venture beyond the capital city to the ancient ruins of Pachacamac. This ancient citadel is vital to the history of Peruvian people, and you will have the luxury of visiting the nationally acclaimed site.

dayInfo.title: Caral – The Oldest Town in the New World
dayInfo.description: Today, you will journey to what has been deemed the Oldest Town in the New World. Located in the Supe Valley, this unique citadel is the most ancient city in the Americas, and it was inhabited during the 26th through the 20th centuries BC. Before you know it, you will arrive in this ancient citadel and delve into the region's mesmerizing history. You will tour fascinating key features of the site like the Main Temple and also catch a glimpse of among 19 other nearby temples. In the evening, you can enjoy dinner along the Pacific shoreline.

dayInfo.title: Nazca Lines – Private Helicopter Ride
dayInfo.description: Today, you will fly over the mysterious Nazca Lines, which are geoglyphs that have left historians and archaeologists guessing for centuries. In the early morning hours, you will fly from Lima to Nazca. Along your journey, you will be provided with spectacular views of the shimmering coastlines near the city of Pisco. You will then meet your expert guide, who will lead you to your private helicopter. Soon after you take off, you will be flying over extraordinary formations. In the afternoon, you can visit nearby wonders like the Cantalloc Aqueduct. Later, you can explore places like the Chauchilla Cemetery and the Cahuachi Pyramid.

dayInfo.title: Paracas – Luxury Cruise to Islas Ballestas
dayInfo.description: Today, you will venture to the coastal shores of Paracas, where colorful beach towels and umbrellas line the shore as people descend on the town for a quick respite. Your day will consist of a luxurious cruise from the shoreline of Paracas to the idyllic Islas Ballestas, which is home to the region's most fascinating wildlife. Peru does boast some of the most diverse plant and animal life on earth, and as you round the jagged island, you may be able to spot rare bird species, such as the Humboldt penguin, the guanay, and a variety of seabirds. You will also witness a myriad of sea mammals, including sea wolves and marine otters.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Departure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can enjoy a few hours of free time to stroll through the picturesque parks of Miraflores or to shop for final souvenirs in Lima's downtown area. This morning will provide you with the perfect opportunity to capture a few more lasting photos as well. Before you know it, your time in Peru will come to a close, and you will meet your guide in front of your hotel to be transferred to Lima's international airport for your flight home.

tourName: Romantic 8-Day Getaway to Peru
placesVisited: Lima, Cusco, Aguas Calientes, Sacred Valley, Machu Picchu
generalInfo: Set off on the excursion of a lifetime during this luxurious, 8-day adventure. Peru is a country that boasts some of the most diverse experiences in the world. Lemon-lime aromas of Peru's ceviche waft from the rugged shoreline, waves crash against the sandy shores, and locals stroll along the grassy cliffside. Indulge in the delicious cuisine of Peru, venture to Machu Picchu, ride horseback through the Sacred Valley, and uncover the allure of Lima.

dayInfo.title: Lima - Sunset Dinner in Miraflores
dayInfo.description: When your plane descends in Peru's capital city, you will catch glimpses of the shimmering shoreline from your window. Once you have made your way through customs, you will be greeted by your private transport, which will escort you to your luxurious accommodation in Lima's high-end neighborhood of Miraflores. After arriving at your hotel, you and your partner will enjoy a relaxed afternoon and evening of leisurely exploration. At sunset, you can choose from a variety of dining options with impeccable panoramic lookout points.

dayInfo.title: Lima - Highlights of the City
dayInfo.description: On your first full day in Lima, your guide will lead you around the city highlights. You will begin your tour beneath the shady palm trees of Plaza de Armas in the historic district. You will even be provided with an opportunity to view the catacombs of the Basilica and Convent of San Francisco of Lima, which is buried beneath the street. After your tour concludes, you will transfer to the Miraflores Lighthouse. In the evening, you and your guide will venture to the eccentric Barranco District, where you will indulge in a moonlit dinner along the Puente de los Suspiros as local bands serenade you with their sweet ballads.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Bartering at Local Markets
dayInfo.description: Today, you will travel to the idyllic city of Cusco, the jumping-off point to the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Machu Picchu. In the morning, you will board a short flight from Lima to Cusco's regional airport. Soon, you will arrive in the white stucco neighborhood of San Blas. As you settle into your luxurious accommodation, your friendly hotel staff will offer you a steeping cup of mate de coca tea. In the evening, you and your partner can wander down the enchanting boulevards to scenic overlooks or miradors as you enjoy some self-guided exploration. As the sun goes down, you and your partner will return to the city center to indulge in a locally-sourced meal while you listen to the lively beats of acoustic bands.

dayInfo.title: Cusco - Saqsaywaman and Tambomachay
dayInfo.description: Today, you will venture beyond the confines of Cusco's city limits to explore breathtaking remnants of Incan innovation and design. About half an hour into your tour, you will come to the site of Saqsaywaman. As you traverse along the grassy hillside, you will learn about the Inca's efforts to protect the city of Cusco, primarily the Sun temple of Qorikancha. Your next expedition will lead you to the site of Tambomachay. Here, you can marvel at the glistening streams of water that sparkle in the sun. In the evening, you will return to Cusco for a relaxing evening in the downtown plazas. If you are feeling adventurous, you can even sample the regional delicacy of cuy, or guinea pig.

dayInfo.title: Sacred Valley - Culture Class and Horseback Riding
dayInfo.description: Today, you will glide through the breathtaking Sacred Valley. Your first stop will be in the charming neighborhood of Chinchero. You will be led on a short tour of the village that will teach you about the community's history in the Sacred Valley. Then, you and your partner will sit in on an authentic yarn dyeing class that will teach you about weaving and dyeing practices. In the afternoon, you and your partner will mount beautiful horses from a nearby resort town to explore the surrounding villages and farmlands. You will also make brief stops at the ancient Incan sites of Moray and Maras.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes - UNESCO Ruins of Machu Picchu
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you and your partner will board a luxury train that is destined for the town of Aguas Calientes. In less than three hours, you will pull into the station at your final destination of Aguas Calientes. As you step off the train, you will be met by your private transportation services who will escort you to your luxury accommodation. Soon, your expert guide will meet you in front of your hotel for a day of exploration at the internationally acclaimed ruins. Once you have reached the summit of Machu Picchu, you can discover key features of this ancient Incan citadel, including the Temple of Three Windows, the Main Plaza, and the Quarry Group.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes - Machu Picchu and Huayna Picchu
dayInfo.description: Today, your guide will lead you to additional gems at Machu Picchu, including the House of the Guards, the Royal Tombs, and the group of Three Doors. You will also dig deeper into the history and spiritual practices of the Incas. Later, you will have the unique opportunity to climb Huayna Picchu, which is the famous peak that is often photographed behind the ruins of Machu Picchu. In the evening, you will descend to the city of Aguas Calientes, where you can relax during a brief respite at your hotel. Then, you will experience the beauty of the town's namesake when you venture to the hot springs that are tucked into a secluded area.

dayInfo.title: Lima - Departure
dayInfo.description: You and your partner will awake to sweet sounds as you prepare for your return trip to Cusco. After a light breakfast, you will once again board a luxury train that will take you through the valley. When you arrive in Cusco a few hours later, you will be met by your local guide and escorted to the Cusco airport. From here, you will board a regional flight back to Lima before connecting to your international flight home.

tourName: Romantic Getaway to Lima & More
placesVisited: Lima, Cusco, Aguas Calientes, Machu Picchu
generalInfo: Set out on the adventure of a lifetime to Peru's bustling capital city. From the moment you and your partner touch down in Lima, you will be greeted with sparkling Pacific shorelines and the refreshing aroma of sea salt. Experience the whimsical romance of this coastal paradise as you amble through the Parque del Amor and gaze at the warm red-orange hues of sunset. Fall in love with the region's delectable cuisine as you roll up your sleeves and partake in an authentic ceviche cooking class. Then, embark hand-in-hand on an unforgettable excursion to the world-renowned ruins of Machu Picchu. This luxurious, 7-day adventure has been personally handcrafted for you and will have you enjoying every moment that you spend in Peru.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Airport Arrival and Dinner Along Pacific Coastline
dayInfo.description: Beginning in the early morning hours, Lima will be bustling with charismatic street vendors who set up booths for the day as hurried traffic winds through the city's major streets. Seagulls will soar above as unrelenting Pacific Ocean waves crash against the shorelines. As the sun draws higher in the sky, children, couples, and families will gather in green public parks for a leisurely picnic. Your airplane will reach Lima by mid-morning, and the intoxicating aroma of sea salt will waft in your direction. Together, you will make your way through customs, which is where your private ground transportation will meet you. As you weave through busy city traffic, you can crack your windows to smell the tantalizing aroma of freshly grilled chicken and the citrusy seafood ceviche . In no time you will arrive at your luxurious hotel in the prestigious neighborhood of Miraflores. The hotel staff will welcome you and show you to your beautiful room with a stunning balcony view. After a brief rest, you can absorb the bird's eye view before exploring the city on foot for the first time. Hand-in-hand, you can stroll with your partner as the sunset warms the evening sky with its orange and red hues. You can stroll through Parque del Amor as soulful guitarists serenade you. Beautiful, mosaic-tiled benches along water's edge will provide the perfect coastal views, and later, you can choose from a plethora of fine dining options that will feature authentic Peruvian dishes. You and your partner can sip on a glass of frothy pisco sour as you cheers to what will surely be an unforgettable adventure in the vibrant city of Lima and the surrounding area.

dayInfo.title: Lima – City Highlights Tour and Authentic Ceviche Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: Birds will chirp in the early morning hours as car radios hum in the distance. Shop owners and cafe servers may clang metal tables and chairs as they set up outdoor patios for the day. The early morning scents of rich coffee and soothing herbal tea will fill the air, and with each passing hour, the pace of city traffic will quicken while the downtown streets become crowded with pedestrian activity. You and your partner can enjoy a light breakfast at one of the dozens of outdoor cafes as you review the day's plans. By mid-morning, your expert guide will meet you in front of your hotel for an in-depth tour of the city center. You will make your way from the modern architecture of the city's coastlines to iconic gems that are further inland and span thousands of years. You will witness relics of Incan and pre-Incan civilizations, the imposing architecture of post-colonial Spanish aesthetic, and everything in between. You will then behold the dramatic architecture of the Plaza de Armas, which is considered the birthplace of the nation's capital. Afterward, you can admire the vibrant facades of the Government Palace, the Cathedral of Lima, and the Archbishop's Palace of Lima. From there, you will continue to the ancient Huaca Pucllana pyramids, which were constructed between the years 200 and 700 AD. In the afternoon, a world-renowned chef will lead you and your partner in a customized cooking class. During this, you will learn how to make Peru's internationally acclaimed seafood of ceviche . Crisp layers of pepper and seafood will offer the perfect crunch to your flavorful dish, and drizzles of tantalizing lemon and lime juice will complete your masterpiece. You and your partner will enjoy a romantic evening with a sunset view as you partake in your delicious creation that will be paired with a glass of sweet, red wine.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Plaza de Armas and Traditional Outdoor Markets
dayInfo.description: Lima's bustling city life will be highlighted as you uncover the captivating rituals and fascinating history that is nestled within the Andes Mountains and mystical Sacred Valley. Early in the morning, you will board a regional flight from Lima to the ancient birthplace of the Inca Empire: Cusco. Here, you will learn about the local culture and explore the charming city as you make your way to the internationally acclaimed ruins of Machu Picchu. Your transfer from the airport will bump along the cobbled streets until you arrive at your luxurious accommodation in the charming neighborhood of San Blas. The hotel staff will greet you and your partner with a steeping cup of mate de coca tea, which is a traditional herbal tea that is said to boost energy levels and offset the effects of altitude sickness. Once you are settled, you can indulge in a self-guided exploration of the city. You can begin at the central Plaza de Armas, which is flanked by the Cusco Cathedral and saturated with lively restaurants, bars, souvenir shops, and nearby museums. The effervescent Avenida del Sol will lead you in search of Qorikancha , which is the ancient Inca Sun Temple. Luscious gardens wrap around the exterior of this impressive edifice, and gold leaf lines the interior. Later this afternoon, you can converse with locals as you peruse the vibrant outdoor markets that are perched atop the city. Indigenous fruits like maracuya , chirimoya, and freshly squeezed juices like mango or banana will prove intoxicatingly refreshing. In the evening, you will return to the Plaza de Armas for a traditional meal with lively musicians who strum traditional melodies in the background. If you are feeling adventurous, you can even try the Andean region's esteemed delicacy, which is known as cuy . At night, you will return to your hotel and rest before an unforgettable two day at the famous UNESCO World Heritage Site of Machu Picchu.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – UNESCO Machu Picchu Ruins
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will board a luxury train ride from the neighboring city of Poroy to the mountain town of Aguas Calientes, which is located at the base of Machu Picchu. From inside the train, you can indulge in panoramic views of the jaw-dropping landscapes through the side and overhead windows. Your train car will snake along the swift waters of the Urubamba River and cross fortified wooden bridges before gliding past small farming villages as friendly locals wave to you from luscious green pastures. In just a few hours, you will arrive at the sleepy town of Aguas Calientes. Ground transport will escort you to your luxury hotel, which will be cradled in the hillside with views that overlook the Urubamba River. By midday, your knowledgeable guide will meet you in front of your hotel for a tailored tour of Machu Picchu. You will board your ground transportation and weave back and forth up the steep switchback road that has been cut into the looming mountainside. With each lateral ascent, you will get a better view of the majestic Andes mountain range that stretches into the distance. At the summit, you will deboard as you breathe in the fresh mountain air and catch your first glimpse of the ruins. You will begin your tour at the stone Guard Houses before venturing on to the Old City Gates. Your guide will teach you about Incan spirituality as you trek to the Temple of Three Windows, The Temple of the Condor, and Intihuatana , which is a ritual stone altar likely used for sacrificial purposes. Later today, your guide will give you time as a couple to indulge in additional self-exploration of the site, which will provide you with the utmost freedom to explore the grounds.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – Machu Picchu, Huayna Picchu, and Hot Springs
dayInfo.description: In the early morning, you will awake to the chirps of birds, and you may be lucky enough to spot an Andean condor as it soars above and spreads its massive wings. You can listen to the swift river waters as they churn past the downtown plaza while travelers begin to venture up to the ruins. Your second day at Machu Picchu will provide you and your partner with a fresh vantage point of the ruins. Alongside your guide, you will have the opportunity to summit the mountain peak of Huayna Picchu, which sits at Machu Picchu's rear. You will begin your trek up the steep, stone pathway as you breathe in the sweetly scented flowers and crisp morning air. While the climb is steep, you and your partner will be richly rewarded at the top. Once you have reached the summit, you will truly feel on top of the world as you gaze out on an endless array of dotted mountain peaks. Just below, the famed ruins rest in serene silence and are framed by the surrounding foliage. An hour or so later, after you have returned to the ruins below, you and your partner will enjoy some additional time for self-exploration and idyllic photo opportunities. In the late afternoon, you will descend to Aguas Calientes to experience the beauty of the town's very namesake. Here, you can bask in the soothing waters, which are said to contain medicinal properties, as you look out on the mystic cloud forest and massive hillsides. In the evening, you can choose from a wide array of delectable, three-course meals at the center of town.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Tour of Barranco District and the Prestigious Miraflores
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will depart Aguas Calientes as you once again indulge in a scenic train ride through the captivating Sacred Valley, across lush terrain, and around looming mountain peaks. In Cusco, you and your partner will board a regional flight back to Lima. You will enjoy your final day in Lima by touring the modern neighborhoods of Miraflores and the Barranco District with your expert guide. As your timing allows, your guide will lead you through the public parks of Parque Grau and Parque del Amor as you enjoy inspiring coastal views. You can venture to the Miraflores Lighthouse, where you will learn about restoration efforts and the rebuilding of the original 1900 lighthouse, which was built in Punta Coles. Your guide will give you a brief history of Miraflores and its impact on Peruvian culture. Later, you will wander to the flamboyant Barranco District where vibrant red, yellow, and blue hues of post-colonial buildings pop against the muted cobblestone streets. Intricate street art bursts around every corner, and live musicians provide a jubilant soundtrack in the background. Then, you can cross the famous Puente de los Suspiros as you appreciate the beautiful buildings, towering palm trees, and quaint cafes. You can also choose from several romantic dining options for a memorable last night in Peru.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Airport Departure and Connect to International Flights
dayInfo.description: As the sun rises on your final day in Peru, you will travel down to the oceanfront for one last cup of coffee or mate de coca beneath the warm Peruvian sun. You and your partner will watch as the waves crash and sky gliders hover from cliffside to the sandy beaches below. Soon, you will be met in front of your hotel with private transportation to Lima's international airport.

tourName: Romantic Getaway Tour to Illustrious Peru
placesVisited: Lima, Nazca, Cusco, Sacred Valley, Machu Picchu, Aguas Calientes
generalInfo: Join hands with your partner as you step into the fairytale landscape of Peru. Adventure, culture, and unparalleled sightseeing await you as you embark on this once-in-a-lifetime adventure. Vibrant city life abounds as you navigate the energy and enthusiasm of Lima. Meanwhile, the tranquil serenity of the Sacred Valley and Aguas Calientes offer the ideal backdrop to relax and unwind on this magical couple's retreat. You'll cheers with a glass of pisco sour as you make memories that will last a lifetime.

dayInfo.title: Lima – City Highlights and Moonlit Dinner
dayInfo.description: You are sure to beam with excitement as you land at Lima's International Airport and begin your romantic retreat in Peru. After making your way through customs, you will meet your expert guide. From there, you will travel via private ground transportation to your luxury hotel in Lima's most prestigious neighborhood of Miraflores. Crisp, white skyscrapers line boulevards as couples stroll through verdant parks below. You will get your first glimpse of the sparkling oceanfront as you near the opulent neighborhood. Upon arrival, the hotel staff will greet you with a local cup of mate de coca tea, a famous herbal tea in Peru. Then, in the afternoon, you will venture into the city with your partner for some relaxed self-exploration. You can stroll along the cobbled streets of Lima's downtown before taking in the sunset and crashing waves from the picturesque Parque del Amor. Finally, you can enjoy a romantic moonlit dinner along the coast where you can bite into the most delicious local flavors, including Peru's national dish, citrusy ceviche . You will cheers with a glass of the country's famed pisco sour before returning hand-in-hand to your five-star hotel.

dayInfo.title: Nazca – Private Helicopter Ride over Nazca Lines
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you are in for the thrill of a lifetime as you jet set on a private helicopter ride over the ancient Nazca Lines. After a relaxing cup of coffee or tea along the Plaza de Armas, you will take off on an extraordinary adventure to the deserts of Peru. You will board a short regional flight from Lima to Nazca, where you will meet your expert guide. You will whiz along scenic desert landscapes before arriving at Nazca's quaint downtown. From here, you will join your expert guide for the history lesson of a lifetime as you explore the jaw-dropping geometric and animal-inspired designs, known as the Nazca Lines. While historians still debate how and why ancient civilizations built these mysterious formations, there's no denying their meticulous design and sheer size. It's the perfect photo-taking opportunity from an idyllic bird's eye view. In the late afternoon, you will travel to the beautiful rocky shores of the San Fernando area for a relaxing bite to eat as you look out on the lapping waves. You can sample one of several traditional delicacies, including escabeche, pickled vegetables served with delectable grilled chicken.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Plaza de Armas and San Blas Neighborhood
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will get a true sense of culture and tradition when you descend on the bustling city of Cusco. As you approach the main Plaza de Armas, you will see the downtown littered with energetic backpackers, vibrant shops, and charismatic street vendors selling everything from candies and keychains to finely crafted woolen goods. For many travelers, Cusco is a short stop en route to Machu Picchu. For locals, the city is a point of national pride with its own distinct charm and character. After settling into your five-star hotel in the heart of the downtown, you will spend the daylight hours exploring the city's many gems. You will peruse open-air markets and chat with local sellers before stepping inside ornate Spanish cathedrals with grand facades and opulent gold interiors. Later, you will make your way down Avenida del Sol to visit the Sun Temple, the Incas' most impressive structures in the city with great fortitude and meticulous gardens out front. In the evening, you will return to the main plaza for a moonlit dinner beneath the shimmering stars.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Ancient Inca Ruins
dayInfo.description: You will rise the next morning as the vibrant Peruvian sun peaks over the looming Andes Mountains. You can enjoy a fresh cup of mate de coca tea from your private hotel balcony or venture into one of the city's numerous sunkissed patios to enjoy a light breakfast. Momentarily, you will meet your expert guide in front of your hotel for a day of historic intrigue beyond the confines of downtown. First, you will arrive at the ancient Inca site known as Tambomachay perched atop the city. As you step out of your private ground transportation, you will first be greeted by the sound of trickling water streaming from ancient Inca aqueducts. As you near the large stone basins, you will surely be in awe of their grand construction and precision. Your guide will transport you back in time as you learn about the noble elite who used the site as a spa resort away from the busyness of city life. Then, you will travel to nearby Saqsayhuaman, where you will marvel at the stoic military fortress. As you get an up-close look at the mortarless stone walls, your guide will explain that the spacing is so tight, not even a sheet of paper could pass.

dayInfo.title: Sacred Valley – Buggy Ride and Private Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will begin your journey to the internationally acclaimed ruins of Machu Picchu. Of course, you will be traveling in style as you board an all-terrain buggy. Then, with your partner, you will link hands as you race along the grassy green fields and weave in and out of the Andean foothills. The swift waters of the Urubamba River will churn, and you will see alpaca and llama freely grazing on the hillside. By early afternoon, you will arrive in the lovely town of Chinchero, marked by white stucco facades and flowery green fields. Here, you will partake in an invigorating cooking class alongside a world-renowned chef. Together with your partner, you will learn to make lomo saltado, a rich blend of onion, peppers, tomato, and marinated sirloin. This traditional Peruvian staple is most often served with rice and potatoes and enjoyed as a delicacy in the Andean region. You and your partner will indulge in your delectable creation as you look out on the seemingly endless blue skies and rolling hilltops.

dayInfo.title: Machu Picchu/Aguas Calientes – UNESCO World Heritage Site
dayInfo.description: Today may very well be the pinnacle of your trip as you travel by train through the Sacred Valley to the famed ruins of Machu Picchu. You will board your luxury train car at the ancient ruins of Ollantaytambo, a refuge for the Incas escaping the Spanish colonizers. Along your two-hour train ride, you will enjoy mesmerizing views of the valley from panoramic windows stretched to the sides of the train car and overhead. Then, in no time, you will arrive at Aguas Calientes at the base of the ruins. Over the course of the day, you will stroll alongside your expert guide through the ruins' many highlights, including the Sacred Rock, Temple of Three Windows, and House of the Guards. You will surely snap stunning photographs with distant mountain peaks looming in the background and the occasional llama or alpaca in the forefront. If you are feeling adventurous, your guide will also provide you the opportunity to climb Huayna Picchu, situated just behind the famous Machu Picchu ruins. In the evening, you will descend the switchback roads along the hillside and take a dip in the medicinal hot springs from which the town of Aguas Calientes gets its name.

dayInfo.title: Lima – International Departure
dayInfo.description: On your final day in Peru, you will board a regional flight back to Lima. There, you can enjoy a few hours of shopping and relaxation as you once again take in the breathtaking ocean views. You can also sit out on the patio and enjoy one last refreshing glass of pisco sour . Then, you will meet your guide of your hotel and be whisked away to Lima's International Airport. As you look out the window of your private vehicle, you will be reminded of the enchanting memories you have created during your weeklong excursion in Peru. From the thrilling helicopter ride over Nazca and the luxurious train ride through the Sacred Valley to your private cooking class in Chinchero, and of course, your trek to Machu Picchu, your romantic Peru vacation will be complete. Even as you return home, you and your partner will surely be reminiscing over your once-in-a-lifetime experience in the weeks and months to come.

tourName: Savor the Excellent Cuisine of Peru: Immersive Culinary Tour
placesVisited: Lima, Cusco, Machu Picchu, Aguas Calientes, Sacred Valley, Puno, Lake Titicaca
generalInfo: Feast on the enticing charcoal-grilled potatoes and crispy meat of ancient civilizations. Dig your toes into sandy beaches as you crunchy into the citrusy lemon-lime flavors of ceviche . Clink your glasses of frothy pisco sour and look out on the mystic Sacred Valley. When you travel to the distant land of Peru, you are sure to be dazzled by the lush landscapes, enthralled with riveting tales of centuries past, and of course, enticed by some of the world's finest cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Lima – International Arrival and Sunset Dinner Along the Pacific
dayInfo.description: As you look out the airplane window, your gaze will fall towards the shimmering waters of the Pacific Ocean outstretched below. The warm Peruvian sun glistens over the crashing riptide as colorful birds flock to the jagged cliffs nearby. After landing at Lima's International Airport, you will board your private ground transport to the vibrant downtown. Soon, you will arrive in the heart of Lima's opulence and prestige as you round the verdant parks along water's edge to the esteemed neighborhood of Miraflores. There, you will settle in at your luxury hotel and enjoy a steeping cup of traditional mate de coca herbal tea. Then, after a bit of uninterrupted rest, you will venture into the city in the evening to admire the whimsical cobbled streets of the historic district. Shady palm trees at the Plaza de Armas provide the ideal resting place as you marvel at the exquisite colonial architecture of Lima's grand basilica, ornate wooden balconies, and intricate stone fountains. In the evening, you will return to the soothing sounds of crashing waves. An elegant three-course meal awaits you, including Peru's beloved escabeche , a regional favorite of exquisitely marinated chicken and pickled vegetables.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Private Ceviche Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will awake for a thrilling day in the nation's capital, filled with sightseeing and culinary excellence. After a light breakfast at your hotel, you will meet your private tour guide in the renowned Parque del Amor to embark on a tour of the city's highlights. As a group, you will partake in a scenic bike ride along the coastline as exotic birds coo overhead. You will weave past the stoic Miraflores Lighthouse as waves lap fervently along the beaches below. Children pull kite strings as they navigate strong gusts of wind while families picnic in the grassy parks nearby. Before long, you will be greeted by the electric red, orange, and yellow hues of the flamboyant Barranco District. You can cross the famed Puente de los Suspiros bridge to admire historic Spanish mansions refashioned as trendy bars and restaurants. In between buildings, street art pops for all to adore. In the afternoon, you will roll up your sleeves for a thrilling ceviche cooking class alongside a master chef. Together, you will chop pepper and onion and saute locally-sourced seafood. As the course concludes, you can sink your teeth into this national gem paired with a glass of sweet red wine.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Cuy Sampler Event and City Tour
dayInfo.description: On the following day of your Peruvian adventure, you will escape the modern metropolis of Lima for a cultural exploration of epic proportions when you venture to the heart of the Inca Empire. After a short flight from Lima's International Airport, you will touch down in captivating Cusco city where travelers from around the world convene en route to the famed ruins of Machu Picchu. In the morning hours, you will join your seasoned guide on a tour of the city's colorful and boisterous San Pedro Market. You can banter with locals as you peruse booth after booth of artisan crafts, fresh produce, and enticing freshly squeezed fruit juices. You can sip on a local favorite, maracuya , as you stroll amongst the white stucco neighborhood of San Blas and marvel at Cusco's Cathedral. Later that evening, you will take part in a local culinary sampler event at a five-star restaurant in the Plaza de Armas. You will sit down for a luxurious three-course meal paired with an exquisite glass of red wine and sample Peruvian staples, including Cusco's authentic delight: cuy , or guinea pig, grilled to perfection and served with a hearty dose of peppers and potatoes.

dayInfo.title: Machu Picchu/Aguas Calientes – UNESCO World Heritage Site
dayInfo.description: The following day, your expedition will take you to new heights, quite literally as you embark on a summit to the UNESCO World Heritage site of Machu Picchu. Early morning, you be whisked off on a luxury train ride from the neighboring town of Poroy to the base of the acclaimed ruins. As you make your way along the serene Urubamba River, you can look out on the breathtaking terracing and sunkissed rolling hills of the Sacred Valley from the train car's panoramic windows. A cup of mate tea will serve you well as you acclimate to the altitude. A few hours later, you will arrive in the mystical mountain town of Aguas Calientes. Here, your guide will show you to your five-star hotel nestled into the foothills complete with a private balcony. By late morning, you and your guide will wind up jaw-dropping switchback roads before arriving at the legendary ruins themselves. Together, you will marvel at the site's most fascinating features, including Sacred Rock and the Principal Plaza. Then, enjoy some self-exploration to visit other notable sites like the Temple of Three Windows and Group of Three Doors. Meanwhile, you will marvel at the Andes mountains cascading into the distant horizon.

dayInfo.title: Sacred Valley – Pisco Tasting and Horseback Riding
dayInfo.description: The sunlight sparkles on the swift waters of the Urubamba River. Above, the majestic Andean condor spreads its wings, swooping and swerving in search of tantalizing prey. A few hours later, after a romantic return train ride, you will arrive at the fascinating ruins of Ollantaytambo tucked neatly into the Sacred Valley. Here, along with your guide, you will walk amongst the massive stone terracing and careful irrigation system built by the Incas hundreds of years prior as they escaped Spanish invasion in Cusco. Isolated cowbells ring out in the distance of an otherwise tranquil abyss. Then, in the afternoon, you will continue to explore the lush landscapes of the Valley on a picturesque horseback ride. You will gallop through sunkissed fields, past quaint villages, and far-reaching farmlands, to the unassuming yet beautiful town of Pachar. Here, in the illustrious countryside, you can delight in a pisco sour tasting event. A celebrated pisco expert will guide you through several variations of Peru's beloved national drink as you compared the citrusy, lemon-lime flavors of this frothy favorite. Sunset elicits the Valley's true beauty as the grasslands begin to glow at near-dusk.

dayInfo.title: Puno/Lake Titicaca – Fresh Lake Trout and Uros Islands
dayInfo.description: The mesmerizing deep blue waters of Lake Titicaca await you the following day as you venture south. In the early morning hours, you will board a short regional flight from Cusco to the lake's base city of Puno. An ornate basilica flanks the central Plaza de Armas, just a short walk from your luxury hotel accommodations. You will spend the day on a serene boat cruise atop the shimmering lake waters. Surrounding the lake are verdant, undulating hills juxtaposed with the lake's rich blue waters. By noon, you will arrive at the famous Uros Islands, or "floating islands" as they're often referred to. The Uros people constructed these fascinating artificial masses as they escaped persecution by the Inca Empire. After stepping foot on the island, you will take part in a reed weaving class where you will learn how locals have maintained their homes for centuries. In the afternoon, you will dock along the shores to indulge in a local feast of fresh trout, sauteed in citrusy lemon dressing, and served with a beautiful array of greens and a glass of sparkling white wine. From the restaurant's private patio, you can enjoy a 360-degree view of the lake and the expanses of greenery beyond.

dayInfo.title: Lima – International Departure
dayInfo.description: On your last day in Peru, you will return to Lima for one final day of self-guided exploration. Your morning begins with a tour of the House of Peruvian Gastronomy, where you will see how famous dishes like pachamanca and pollo a la brasa have been prepared for thousands of years. Later that day, you can choose between a visit to the National Museum of Peruvian Culture or peruse the city's Art Museum of Lima. After a light lunch along the Plaza de Armas, you can indulge in an afternoon of shopping and leisure as you return to the picturesque coastline and the distinguished neighborhood of Miraflores. Then, by late afternoon, you will meet your private ground transfer in front of your hotel, where you will be whisked away to Lima's International Airport. You will say your final goodbyes to your tour guide before boarding your flight home. As you once again look out the plane window, this time at the setting sun, you will taste the lemon-lime zest of ceviche of Lima, the crisp grilled trout of Lake Titicaca, and the delectable pisco sour of the mystical Sacred Valley. It's not a forever farewell, merely a brief parting until your return to delve further endless array of eclectic Peruvian cuisine.

tourName: Serene Landscapes and Famous Culture Peru Tour
placesVisited: Lima, Cusco, Sacred Valley, Machu Picchu, Puno, La Paz
generalInfo: No trip to Peru is complete without witnessing the abundance history and raw natural beauty of the land and this 11-day tour of the country will present you with plenty of both. As you make your way from the seaside splendor of Lima to the windswept heights of Cusco, a blend of leisure time and guided exploration will ensure your full excitement at each of the memorable destinations you visit.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Wheels Down in Peru's Capital
dayInfo.description: There is no shortage of exciting activities in Peru and today you will be able to enjoy one of the best ambassadors for the rich cultural history found here in abundance through the capital city of Lima. Perched atop rugged bluffs overlooking the Pacific Ocean, Lima dates back to the indigenous population of Peru who prized the region for its fertile soil and today the city will present you a vibrant atmosphere to enjoy your inaugural day. After your arrival to the main airport, a comfortable transfer will ensure your arrival to the city center where the remainder of the day will be yours.

dayInfo.title: Lima – An Orientation in a UNESCO Heritage Site
dayInfo.description: Although Peru presents some of the finest attractions and beauty of South America, those that skip Lima to head straight to the Sacred Valley will miss the allure of the country's vibrant capital. It is this allure that you will be able to witness firsthand on a guided excursion of the old town where a knowledgeable guide will walk you through the city's superb colonial architecture, the famous Larco museum, and the Casa Aiaga before you can enjoy the remainder of the afternoon strolling the cobbled alleys and colorful neighborhoods at your own pace.

dayInfo.title: Sacred Valley – Walking in the Footsteps of the Inca
dayInfo.description: Today you will turn your back on the stunning seaside beauty of Lima in search of higher elevations and as you climb into the heart of the scenic Andean mountain range, the lofty heights, as well as the scenic views, will take your breath away.
