Your guide will then prepare steeping cups of the herbal tea for you as you look out on the stunning terraces of Ollantaytambo that are visible in the distance.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – UNESCO Ruins Summit
dayInfo.description: As the sun begins to climb in the sky, you will step aboard a luxury train car that will be equipped with a 360-degree view of the Valley as you make your way to the UNESCO World Heritage site of Machu Picchu. You will encounter iridescent waterways, chug past small villages with roaming cattle and vicuñas, and glide across lovely, orange bridges that pop against the green-blue backdrop. Mid-morning, you will arrive at the base city of Aguas Calientes. Here, you will be met by your local, private transport who will escort you to your five-star hotel that will be nestled into the foothills of the Andes Mountains. Once you are checked in, you can relax on your private balcony as you admire the hushed mountain village below. Then, as the sun draws to its peak, you will meet your guide in front of your hotel who will accompany you to the entrance of the ruins. You will ascend steep, switchback roads in your private transport as you draw nearer. Less than an hour later, you will step off at the grounds of Machu Picchu for an incredible first glance at the site. You will spend the afternoon alongside your guide at some of the most notable monuments and relics, including the Principal Temple, the Temple of Three Windows, The Royal Tomb, the Houses of the Guards, and the Gateway to the Old City. You can look out on the massive, Andean peaks and the warm hues of the horizon, which will seem just beyond reach. In the evening, you will return to Aguas Calientes for a relaxing night in the village's downtown where you will rest up for another thrilling day at the ruins in the morning.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – Hot Springs of Aguas Calientes
dayInfo.description: Your second day of discovery at the coveted Machu Picchu ruins will bring you to the site of the Sacred Rock and Intihuatana, which is a massive stone that has been formed in the shape of an altar. Both places allude to an Inca history that is rich with spiritual practices. Many historians believe that Sacred Rock was created as a geographical representation of the surrounding terrain while others assert that it was used for astrological study. Regardless, both serve as prime examples of Inca design and their acute stonework abilities. Later in the day, you will have the option to summit Huayna Picchu, which is an impressive mountain peak that sits at Machu Picchu's rear. The steep climb, though strenuous, rewards its hikers with breathtaking views of the outstretched valley below. For those travelers opting not to make the climb, you will have additional time to tour the ruins and explore the final portion of the Inca Trail. In the afternoon, you will return to the base city for a soothing dip in the medicinal hot springs that gave the city its name. You will climb the secluded path that leads to the steamy water's edge. There, you can relax your muscles and unwind. Once you have dried off and worked up an appetite, you will stroll to the lively, central plaza for a three-course meal of classic Andean dishes like the patasca , which is a corn-based soup. You may also choose from a variety of hearty vegetables, beef or chicken, and potato medleys.

dayInfo.title: Madre de Dios – Arrival in Jungle and Indigenous Fruit Sampler
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will have to say goodbye to the wonder and awe of the Andes Mountains and set out for the beauty and mystery of the secluded Amazon Rainforest. You will first board the scenic train back to Cusco where you will then board a short flight as you set out for the Madre De Dios region of the Peruvian Amazon. As you touch down, you will be welcomed with wafts of fresh air and the vivacious coos, squeals, and hums of diverse wildlife. Your expert guide will accompany you by land and by water as you set out on a beautiful riverboat cruise, which is destined for your intimate lodge accommodations that are hidden away in the thick foliage that is symbolic of the Amazon. You will settle into your luxury hotel as you lay out on your shaded balcony or sway in your comfortably private hammocks. In the afternoon, you will meet a local food expert who will teach you about the delicious and colorful fruit of the Amazon. You can sample the dark green, mouth-watering limes as you bite into the sweet custard of the creamy, white chirimoya. Watch as your instructor cuts open the outer green shell of the guava to reveal a vibrant pink inside. The pepino melon and starchy lucuma are also local favorites. You will join your guide and food instructor as you learn to press the fruits into refreshingly, sweet juices to enjoy on your sun-kissed patio.

dayInfo.title: Madre de Dios – Hiking Trail Expedition and Amazonian Cooking Class
dayInfo.description: On day two of your expedition through the Amazonian Jungle, you will meet your guide for an exciting day of sightseeing. You will explore trails near your campsite that wind through thick foliage and pass by the dwellings of some of the region's most fascinating animals, including everything from agile spider monkeys to neon-colored tree frogs. You will forge a path to several lookout towers that are buried deep within the forest for unparalleled views. Then, you will hop aboard your riverboat cruise where you will travel to the macaw clay licks. As you glide across the swift waters, you can catch a glimpse of the stunning technicolor hues of the macaw bird. Watch as they soar to the peak of the clay lick and perch with dozens of vibrantly colored, feathered birds. Grab a pair of binoculars or look through your guide's telescope for the best look. Later in the day, you will make your way from water to land as you deboard at a scenic alcove with large shady green leaves and foliage that will be bursting with pinks and yellows. You can listen to the hot spring streams as they cascade from cliffs to the serene basins below, and gather as a group to learn about traditional cuisine in the Amazon. Among the region's staple foods is the plantain, which serves as a base in many dishes. Here, you will meet your expert chef from the previous day who will teach you the best revered of all Amazonian dishes: juanes. This delicious meal includes cooked rice that is combined with grilled chicken and wrapped tightly in banana leaves and grilled to perfection. You will sample the dish to satisfy your Amazonian cravings.

dayInfo.title: Madre de Dios – Ziplining and Conservation Center Visit
dayInfo.description: Your final day in the Amazon will be all about thrill and adventure. You will begin your day with a fresh fruit juice atop your balcony. Then, you will meet your guide below and depart for an adrenaline rush unlike any other. Here, you will set out on a short hike until you come upon the massive stretch of zipline across the treetops. One by one, you will mount the zipline and whiz along the jungle's beautiful canopy layer as you listen to the rustling leaves as spider monkeys shift around you and swing from the swaying branches. You can take mental photos of the gorgeous riverway in the distance and the towering timbers beyond. In the afternoon and after a light lunch at your lodge, you will join your guide at a nearby conservation center where you will learn about the work students, scientists, researchers, and volunteer activists who commit to the Rainforest’s preservation in order to preserve the jungle and its wildlife. You can meet the critters who call the center home before they are rehabilitated and then released once more into the wild. You can also take a short hike with a conservation center staff to spot rare reptiles and camouflaged insects in their natural habitat. As day turns to evening, you will retreat to your lodge for a delectable dinner of inchicapi , which is a coup that is prepared with chicken, peanuts, cilantro, and cassava.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Connect to International Flights Home
dayInfo.description: After a light breakfast, you must say your parting goodbyes to your expert chef and the beauty of the Amazon beyond. You will board your private transport for one last look at the region's jaw-dropping landscapes before winding down narrow mountain roads as cascading streams hug the cliffside beneath you. You will snake your way through the cloud forest as the morning mist wakes sleeping foliage. Finally, you will return to Cusco where you will catch a regional flight to Lima and connect to your international flights home. You can wave to your guide out the plane window as you depart a country with a storied past, intriguing present, and hopeful future in the years to come.

tourName: Unexpected Peru Tour for Seniors
placesVisited: Lima, Palcoyo, Madre de Dios, Llachon, Chinchero
generalInfo: On this seven-day adventure to Peru, you will uncover the best-kept secrets this region of the world has to offer. Visit charming towns nestled into the hillside of the Sacred Valley, trek to the lesser-known Rainbow Mountain in Palcoyo, and fall asleep among the thick vegetation and exotic bird calls of the Madre de Dios region of the Amazon Rainforest.

dayInfo.title: Lima – The Barranco District
dayInfo.description: Your 7-day Peru will begin when you arrive in the nation's capital. After collecting your belongings, a private driver will greet and transfer you to your accommodation in the heart of the city. Although many tourists tend to stay in downtown hotels, you will enjoy a vivacious evening in the Barranco District. You can walk across the Puente de los Suspiros for stunning views of the cobblestone streets and vibrant backdrop. In the evening, you will travel by bike to the opulent neighborhood of Miraflores. Here, you can enjoy a luxurious meal by sunset.

dayInfo.title: Palcoyo – Rainbow Mountain
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will fly to Cusco. After settling in to your accommodation, you can spend the first part of the day exploring Cusco, shopping among the frenetic energy of Avenida del Sol, or visiting Qorikancha Temple. By early afternoon, you will meet your guide and begin the two-hour journey to the small town of Palcoyo. While thousands of visitors flock daily to the official Rainbow Mountain, this lesser-known alternative provides a lighter hike, significantly smaller crowds, and avoids some of the environmental issues, such as erosion, that have arisen at Rainbow Mountain. After your visit, you can stop in the small town of Palcoyo to shop for souvenirs.

dayInfo.title: Chinchero – Culture Class and Horseback Ride
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will board a private shuttle and set out for the Sacred Valley. In the morning, you can enjoy a light breakfast beside the Plaza de Armas before breaking away from Cusco's downtown. Along the perimeter, you will stop at the sites of Tambomachay and Saqsayhuaman. After, you will begin the illustrious journey through the Sacred Valley. Here, you will attend a culture class in the village of Chinchero that will teach you about ancient wool dyeing and weaving techniques. In the afternoon, you will have the chance to explore the valley on horseback.

dayInfo.title: Madre de Dios ��– Birdwatching in the Amazon
dayInfo.description: Today, you will embark on an adventure to Peru's Amazon Rainforest. On your first day in the rainforest, you can settle in to your secluded lodge accommodation in the rainforest. By mid-day, you will set out with your guide along the river in hopes of spotting the Amazon's most beautiful bird species. With binoculars in hand, you will keep watch at the famous clay licks, on which the macaw birds are known to perch after traveling hundreds of miles across the Amazon. In the evening, you will join your guide on a short evening hike to uncover the captivating animals of the night.

dayInfo.title: Madre de Dios – Local Tasting Event
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can partake in a short walk for an up-close look at the local flora and medicinal properties of many of the local vegetation. Then, you and your guide will set out on a riverboat cruise to Cordillera del Pantiacolla, the Cocha Salvador wildlife refuge, and Monkey Island to see many of the Amazon's famous spider monkeys. On the return trip, you will stop at a small alcove of thermal hot springs. In the afternoon, you will attend a culture class that will teach you about the indigenous tribes that have called Peru's Madre de Dios region home for generations.

dayInfo.title: Llachon – Lake Titicaca and Trout Dinner
dayInfo.description: After two days in the Amazon Rainforest, you will make your way to Lake Titicaca. In the morning, you can explore the city of Puno, which is situated at the base of the lake. Although the city has a charming downtown, Puno is best known for its annual carnival festivities that attract thousands of visitors each year. Your guide will lead you along the route of the procession and show you vibrant examples of festive clothing. Around mid-day, you will sail along the water of Lake Titicaca and stop at the artificial floating islands.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Departure
dayInfo.description: Your Peruvian adventure will conclude with a brief exploration of Lima. In the morning, you will board a flight to Lima and stow luggage at your hotel in Miraflores so that you can experience your last hours of metropolitan life in Lima. For the first half of the day, your guide will lead you on a tour of the downtown area. In the afternoon, you will meet your guide in front of your hotel and transfer to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: Wonders of Peru Tour: Amazon Safari, Machu Picchu, Lake Titicaca & Nazca Lines
placesVisited: Lima, Amazon Basin, Machu Picchu, Lake Titicaca, Cusco, Nazca
generalInfo: Peru’s rich culture will enchant you with its incredible charm and irresistible sights. Ancient ruins, beautiful cities, and the mesmerizing Amazon await you. The mix of Andean culture and sensational wildlife of the rainforest beckon you with spectacular scenery, rich textiles, delicious nourishment, and non-stop wonder. From the heights of Lake Titicaca to the unique Nazca Lines, Peru is filled with marvels to be seen and experienced. From Incan wonders to wild adventures, this trip will truly be Inca-credible.

dayInfo.title: Lima – King’s Welcome
dayInfo.description: Arrive in Lima and revel in the City of Kings. The neighborhoods stretch across the metropolis, from the cool shores of the ocean to the foothills of the surrounding mountains. The boisterous sounds of trolley cars rushes through the streets. You can smell the ocean in the air mixing with sweet citrus from fresh ceviche. Each neighborhood offers a variety of culture and flavors distinct from one another. Visit the Mercado Surquillo to see the sensational farmers’ market of Lima, where the stalls are perfumed with decadent goods straight from the sea as well as the fruits of the mountains. Huacatay, Peruvian black mint, hangs from the stalls giving a zesty and luscious spice that carries through the aisles. The vibrant colors of bananas and sweet potatoes carry along the market like rainbows. The life of Lima is active and is buried deep within the cultural roots of the people that call the city home.

dayInfo.title: Amazon – Incredible to Amazing
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart from the City of Kings and make your way to the incredible city of Puerto Maldonado located along the Amazon Basin. You can feel the warm weather wrap itself around you as you exit the airport and board a boat that will take you into the depths of the forest. The trees reach along the riverbanks as far as you can see. The river is wide and calm. The splendors of the Amazon are becoming increasingly clearer and inviting to you as you explore the sensational wild. The city boasts a colonial past left over from the rubber boom. Various buildings have lavish balconies that wrap around the entire second floor, decorated with detailed wooden railings. The scent of sugar fills the streets from milled sugar cane juice made fresh from street venders. Board another boat for an excursion along the river where you can settle into the exquisite accommodation of Posada Amazonas, located up river from Puerto Maldonado. Watch the speed of the black and white Pied Lapwing as it maneuvers through the sky along the edge of the canopy. Black Skimmers skate across the water’s surface in search of fish, the sound of rippling water rises into the air. Arrive at the beautiful and unique Posada Amazonas where wooden bridges stretch over the lush Amazon surface. The thatched roofs of the resort blend into the canopy from a distance. A cool breeze drifts through the room and the leaves outside rustle. You can hear the distant caw of parrots as you settle into the Amazon.

dayInfo.title: Amazon – Morning Glory and Lakeside Beauty
dayInfo.description: Rise with the sun as the light begins to shine through the canopy. Morning in the Amazon brings the cool air beneath the trees. The sounds of bustling birds sing in the distance. Venture out to explore the bustle of the jungle and come across the fabulous clay lick. The cliff side is filled with natural vitamins within the mineral rich soil, hovering beneath lush green vines. The clay shines a faded pink in the morning sun while macaws and parrots flap their wings, caw at one another, and climb along the cliff snapping at the wall. Stunning blues and reds wave into the air with each wing flap of the macaw. Parrots glow green and yellow against the hue of the clay. From the wall it is a lovely and quick hike through open vines and lingering tree branches to reach Tres Chimbadas Lake. The water is serene, mirroring the sky and the surrounding trees along the shore. Whether on a boat or at the edges of the observation deck, you can watch the water come to life with turtles slipping along the surface or giant river otters sunbathing on the shore. They are fast in the water but large on land reaching over five-and-a-half feet long. Their tails help propel them through the fresh lake and to blend in with fallen branches. Atop the 100 foot observation deck you can view the lake and the wildlife almost from within the canopy of the trees themselves. The kaleidoscope of toucans is iridescent against the leaves. Macaws radiate a deep blue against the tree bark. The peaceful moments above the Amazon give you a deeper connection to the majesty of the wild and the sensations of the incredible.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Rivers to Peaks
dayInfo.description: Leave the stretching waters of the Amazon behind you as you fly above the canopy and make your way over the Andes and venture into the oldest continuously inhabited city in South America, Cusco. The air is crisp and cold along the cobblestone streets of the city. The stones are a vast difference from the wooden walkways and earthen paths of the Amazon. The cologne of burnt sugar follows you through the streets, along with the tanginess of Pisco, the traditional Peruvian spirit. Enjoy the remainder of the day on a tour through the city and its surroundings to experience the collection and connection of Spanish and Incan remains. The Plaza de Armas is considered the main square of Cusco and looks like the capitol of a city in Spain. It is easy to see that much of colonial Cusco was built on the foundations of the Incan stonework and layout. Santo Domingo Church is considered to be the mother of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Cusco filled with history and an incredible amount of colonial artwork having transitioned into more of a museum in recent years. The church was once the ancient Temple of the Sun, home to gold lined walls and Spanish dreams of El Dorado. Although the foundation of the original structure remains, the Spanish church rose in its stead. The church is constructed with mortar and stone giving the structure a medieval look and a textured feel. The spire is adorned with a dome and various smaller spires that wrap around the bell tower. The magnitude of the church is impressive; from its entrance it would seem that the church was two stories; however, as you journey through the building you find that the church follows the downward slope of the street, leading into lush gardens that lay beneath the looming stone. The flowers that spread along the courtyard give a gentle bouquet to the coarse and aged grit. The beauty of Cusco is filled in its layers of history, along with its hidden and not so hidden gems, from the Spanish facades to the Incan ruins.

dayInfo.title: Ollantaytambo – The Sacred Valley of the Inca
dayInfo.description: Venture into the depths of the Sacred Valley where the Andean culture remains strong and the varied remains of the Incan culture are built along the walls of the valley. The ruins of Pisac sit along a plateau giving a tremendous view of the surrounding valley and the encircling mountains. The stones shine a rich red and pink in the morning sun, in contrast to the deep green of the valley. Terraces climb the sloping mountains like stairs. The citadel sits at the top of the terraces, the structures still intact; the aged brick open to the elements and fragile against your skin. Continue to the royal estate of an Inca Emperor at Ollantaytambo. The site was once the capital of the Incan empire during the resistance of the Spanish. The scent of roasted choclo, large kernel corn, drifts from the town and lingers against the stones of the ruins. Steep terraces climb up a central hill of the site, surrounded by sheer rock making the area look more like a fortress than a religious center. Each tier stretches the width of the mountainside and clambers up the valley from the river below, marked with one set of stairs. The gentle trickle of water rises from “The Bath of the Princess,” a single stone with tiered designs carved into a fountain that sits at the base of the ruins. The valley is lush with incredible vegetation and history spreading through the hills.

dayInfo.title: Aguas Calientes – The Lost City of the Inca
dayInfo.description: Today you will wind through the foothills of the Sacred Valley and along the rushing Urubamba River. The green valley and mountaintops never seem to fade. Arrive at the base of the Machu Picchu and ascend into the saddle of the mountain 1,000 feet above the rush of the river. Climb the stone steps that take you higher to the plateau where the rocky walls open and give way to the expanse of the Lost City. The integrity of the stone structures continues to decorate the mountaintop, as Huayna Picchu casts a shadow over the ruins from its mammoth peak. In the opposite direction you can see the three pillars of the Sun Gate sitting above the clouds and looking down on the city. The grass is soft and lush. The ruins give a faint musk of wet stone. Terraces continue to tier the mountainside. The hitching post of the sun stands at a tall and open point; it’s large, round stone standing above the city, within the confines of the remaining walls, continuing to tell the time.

dayInfo.title: Cusco – Inca Lost City to Inca Capital
dayInfo.description: The sun rises over the stones of Machu Picchu and brings a bright glow to the plateau. The clouds dance around the terraces before disappearing. For an incredible view of the Lost City, take the long walk to the Sun Temple. The stone path leads the way along the mountainside. Llamas graze on the rich grass, their mouths moving sideways with each bite. Once at the Sun Temple you can see carvings circle around the tower to pinpoint the position of the sun during the summer solstice. Rock slabs and stones surround the structure, but the most recognized detail about the Sun Temple is the view. The entire city of Machu Picchu is open to you like a postcard, from the details of the ruins to the peak of Huayna Picchu. The clouds have long dispersed and your view of the Lost City of the Incas is nothing less than breathtaking. Eventually you will make your way back to Cusco, but for the moment you can sit along the smooth stone slabs of the temple and enjoy the view.

dayInfo.title: Lake Titicaca – City-side to Lakeside
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart from the pearled city of Cusco and venture farther along the stretch of Andean beauty. The altiplano , which stands for the high altitude plains, is a copious mixture of craggy rock and swaying grass. Stop in Andahuaylillas, known for its incredible baroque church nicknamed the Sistine Chapel of America. The exterior is stationed above several stairs; the white bell tower is iridescent in the sun while the mountains surround the church in the background. The pillars of the façade are made of alternate, smoothed stone, the second story adorned with a mosaic of Andean life. Inside the church you are immediately surrounded by a haze of frankincense. The columns are gilded to the ceiling where geometric designs add to the hypnotic artwork of the church. With the wind of the high plains calling, you continue on to Puno and your hotel. As the largest high altitude navigable lake in the world, Lake Titicaca sparkles outside your window.

dayInfo.title: Lake Titicaca – A Taste of Taquile
dayInfo.description: The sun rises over Puno and radiates along the water of Lake Titicaca. Venture out onto the lake, the scent of fresh water drifts into the air and mist bounces off of your cheeks. The boat glides through the water. Islands decorate the horizon; however, a few islands seem to shimmer in the morning light. They drift with the wake of the lake and your boat nestles into a small dock. You have arrived at one of the famous floating islands of the Uros. The islands are made with dried totora shoots, wound and woven to make a steady surface. You can feel the rough shell of the dried grass on the soles of your feet. The fragrance drifts through the open air of the lake. The houses are made from the same reeds as the island itself. The locals are as colorful as the textiles you saw in Pisac market, bright pinks and reds gleaming along the clear waters of the lake. After the floating island you will continue along Lake Titicaca until you come to the gentle natural harbor of Taquile Island, a stationary island almost 30 miles east of Puno. The slope of the island is steep from shore to tip with terraces that stretch along the sides of the island allowing for agriculture and irrigation. The town sits along a tiny plateau with some homes edging along the less steep slopes of the hills. The roofs are a bright pink while the stone buildings keep the interior cool in the summer and warm in the winter. At the top of the island you can see the expanse of the lake, where the vastness of the water comes to light within the main square of the town. The sun meanders across the sky and you make your way back to the boat to return to the shores of Puno.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Winding Diversity
dayInfo.description: The sparkling clear waters of Lake Titicaca drift beneath you as you fly over the Andes and away from the undulating mountains and vibrant colors. Arrive back in Lima and settle into your luxurious accommodations, located in the beautiful neighborhood of Miraflores. Stroll along the winding walkways where the scent of the sea blows in on the back of the breeze. The Kiss, a large statue in Lover’s Park, showcases two people wrapped in an eternal embrace overlooking the ocean. The cool air of the ocean sweeps across the city and brings you back to the memories of the Machu Picchu and sitting amidst the clouds.

dayInfo.title: Paracas – Lingering Lines
dayInfo.description: Lima stretches out like a distant oasis as you make your way out of the city and into the arid desert of Ica, which is also an important agricultural region of Peru. The sweet smell of grapes and dry earth stretches across the open desert plain. When you arrive in Ica you will board a sightseeing plane and ascend into the open sky to view the famous and mysterious Palpa and Nazca Lines. Scattered around the Nazca plateau, the lines are large geoglyphs showing a variety of natural and geometrical objects, from a bird to a monkey, carved into the earth and stretched over an expansive area only visible from the sky. Continue on to the Haucachina Lagoon to experience the oasis within the sand dunes of the desert. It feels as if you have traveled to the Sahara, with dunes rising and surrounding you in every direction. The palm trees sway in the desert breeze. The natural spring of the oasis is cool against your skin. The sun is warm as it drifts across the sky. From secluded relaxation along the water to the loud rush of adrenaline that comes with dune buggies, around the oasis you can soak in the sun or the sand, both offering the warm embrace of the desert before arriving in the town of Paracas.

dayInfo.title: Lima – Incredible Islands
dayInfo.description: Today you will venture away from the desert oasis of Paracas and cruise along the cool, sweet ocean to the Ballestas Islands. The mist is refreshing and cool blowing in the breeze, while the fresh saltwater scents wraps around you. Look back at shore and see the stationary candelabra of Paracas drawn into the hillside like the Nazca Lines. The Ballestas Islands are a series of rock formations that have become a haven for wildlife along the Peruvian coast. Over the crash of waves you can hear sea lions barking. Their slick bodies lounge in the sun along the shore. Sunlight shines through the craggy holes in the rocky islands like tunnels to nowhere. Once on shore you will journey to the stunning Lagunillas located in the Paracas National Reserve. You can see the arid hills reach the corners of the sea and roll into the horizon. Climb the rocky terrain and look out into the water, the coarse earth hard against your palms. You can hear the crash of waves and the soft whisper of the breeze. Enjoy a delicious and rich lunch at San Jose in Chincha, a colonial hacienda that dates back to the 17th century. The hacienda stretches the length of a city block with arches opening the heart of the building to the outside world. The opulence of the building and the decadence of the food seems like it couldn’t have changed in almost 400 years. After lunch you will return to Lima for your flight home. From the winding eclecticism of Lima to the magical wildlife of the Amazon, the cultural sensations of Lake Titicaca to the unique lines that decorate the Nazca plain, you have traversed Peru and have seen that the city of Machu Picchu that floats in the clouds and the oasis of Paracas as it twinkles beneath the sun. The world is filled with wonders; however, none can beat the Inca-credible wonders of Peru. If you'd like to extend your Peru vacation, take a look at the trip reviews for Machu Picchu . You will get ideas and read about what other travelers enjoyed in Peru.
